0.title: Bank officers' union alleges violation of HR norms by Standard Chartered
0.article_body: The All India Bank Officers' Confederation (AIBOC) has alleged a violation of HR practices by Standard Chartered Bank, requesting its CEO for immediate remedial measures. AIBOC also alleged that the bank is delaying in recognising the Association of Standard Chartered Bank Officers (Kolkata) (ASCBO). It added that it won't condone any attempt to thwart the fundamental rights of ASCBO members.

1.title: Virat Kohli spotted holding his chest after running double against Zimbabwe, video viral
1.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli holding his chest after running double during India's seventh over against Zimbabwe in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. In the video, Kohli can be seen taking a pause after running the quick double and holding his chest. He then took a single off the next ball.

2.title: He was tired: 'Black Panther' director recalls his last call with Chadwick
2.article_body: 'Black Panther' director Ryan Coogler, recalling his last conversation with late actor Chadwick Boseman, said, "He was tired...I could tell he was tired." "I'd been trying to get a hold of him for a few days...I could tell something was up," he added. Chadwick passed away in 2020 aged 43 while battling colon cancer.

3.title: ISRO to explore Venus, plans lunar mission with Japan
3.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is planning to venture to Venus, and is in talks with the Japanese Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) for a lunar rover to explore the moon. According to the plan, a lunar lander and rover built by ISRO will be put into orbit by a Japanese rocket. ISRO is also planning a probe to Mars.

4.title: Tourism Ministry to take part in World Travel Market from Nov 7 in London
4.article_body: India will participate in the World Travel Market from November 7-9 in London to showcase itself as a preferred destination for tourism, the government has said. "After the world's largest vaccination (COVID-19) drive, the country is ready for international tourists," the ministry said in a statement. The theme of this year's exhibition is 'The Future of Travel Starts Now'.

5.title: Karnataka signs MoUs for investments worth more than ₹9 lakh crore
5.article_body: Karnataka has signed Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) for investments worth more than ₹9 lakh crore during the three-day Global Investors Meet. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said of the total MoUs worth ₹9.8 lakh crore, projects worth ₹2.83 lakh crore have already been cleared. Over ₹2 lakh crore of the investment proposals are said to be in the green energy sector.

6.title: My weight has been 74.5 kg to 75 kg for the last 8 years: Virat Kohli
6.article_body: In a recent interview, former Team India captain Virat Kohli stated that his weight has been 74.5 kg to 75 kg for the last eight years. Kohli, in the same interview, stated that his favourite dessert is Malva Pudding. He stated, "You get it in South Africa. I tried it for first time after recommendation of Zaheer Khan in Johannesburg."

7.title: Reliance to acquire Metro Cash & Carry's India business in ₹4,060 cr deal: Report
7.article_body: Reliance Industries will acquire German wholesale retailer Metro Cash & Carry's business in India in a deal estimated at around ₹4,060 crore, PTI reported on Sunday. The deal includes 31 wholesale distribution centres, land banks and other assets owned by the company in India. Reliance didn't confirm the report, but said, "Our company evaluates various opportunities on an ongoing basis."

8.title: HC ruling on wife's right to divorce is beyond its mandate: AIMPLB
8.article_body: The AIMPLB has criticised the Kerala High Court's ruling that a Muslim woman can dissolve her nikah (marriage) without her husband's permission. AIMPLB said the Kerala HC has gone beyond its mandate in the manner it interpreted the Islamic divorce laws. The court held that the wife's right to end her marriage was in conformity with the Quran.

9.title: Cricket is a funny game: Babar after Pak advance to semifinals
9.article_body: After Pakistan advanced to the semifinals of the T20 World Cup 2022, skipper Babar Azam said that cricket is a funny game. "Appreciate all [members of] my team the way they played all matches," Babar said. On winning against Bangladesh on Sunday, Babar said, "Pitch [was]..two-paced...I and Rizwan decided to go long but unfortunately didn't work out."

10.title: Will save Gujarat from deceit of BJP's double engine: Rahul Gandhi
10.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said his party will fulfil the promises it made to Gujarat and save it from the "deceit" of the BJP's "double engine". "LPG cylinder in ₹500, 10 lakh jobs to youth, farmer's loan waiver up to ₹3 lakh," said Rahul. Elections will be held in Gujarat in two phases on December 1 and 5.

11.title: Employee fired by Twitter shares post, says 'Looks like I'm unemployed'
11.article_body: As Elon Musk-owned Twitter started firing employees, tweets from employees about getting fired from the company surfaced online. In one of the tweets, a senior community manager at Twitter, Simon Balmain, revealed that he was fired from the company. "Looks like I'm unemployed...Just got remotely logged out of my work laptop...So sad it had to end this way," he tweeted.

12.title: This is best performance we had among all T20 WCs we played: Shakib
12.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan said that in terms of results, the performance of their country in the T20 World Cup 2022 has been the best among all T20 WCs they have played in. On losing to Pakistan on Sunday, Shakib said, "Knew it was going to be difficult for the new batters so wanted set batters to carry through."

13.title: Come Nov 12, people of HP will say 'Jai Ram ji ki' to CM Thakur: Cong
13.article_body: Come November 12, the people of Himachal Pradesh will say "Jai Ram ji ki" to CM Jai Ram Thakur, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said on Sunday. "The work of the government is something people are unhappy with. There has been huge corruption, paper leaks, financial impropriety and misgovernance. Winds of change are blowing all over the state," Pilot said.

14.title: BJP-ruled MCD spent ₹35 cr in 17 yrs on under-construction hospital: Atishi
14.article_body: AAP leader Atishi said BJP-ruled Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) spent ₹35 crore since 2005 on a hospital in South Delhi which is still "under construction". "BJP promised just one multi-speciality hospital but failed to build even that," Atishi said. She further claimed that only ground and first floors of the hospital in Kalkaji were functional.

15.title: Ola Electric to touch production of 10 lakh units by November 2023: CEO
15.article_body: Ola Electric CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted that the company will touch cumulative production of 10 lakh units by November 2023. Earlier the company had said it has the current capacity of 20 lakh units per annum at its factory. "Starting next week, we will deliver to customers across India same day or within 2-3 days," Aggarwal added.

16.title: Actor Kamal Haasan, filmmaker Mani Ratnam to work together after 35 yrs
16.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan and filmmaker Mani Ratnam will be working together after 35 years. Kamal took to Twitter to make the announcement and wrote, "Here we go again!" The film is tentatively titled 'KH 234' and will be jointly produced by Kamal and Ratnam. Kamal last worked with the 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' filmmaker in the 1987 film 'Nayakan'.

17.title: I have improved, not easy to come back from injury: Shaheen Afridi
17.article_body: After being adjudged as the 'Player of the Match' against Bangladesh on Sunday, Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi said that it's not easy to come back from injury and bowl at 140 kmph. "I have improved...Bowl in the right areas and fast was the plan," Afridi said. Notably, Pakistan have advanced to the semi-finals of the ongoing T20 World Cup.

18.title: Need to play consistently against defensive Spain: Indian hockey skipper
18.article_body: Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that their side needs to play consistently across all four quarters against "defensive" Spain who have the ability to slow their opponent's game. "Playing consistently all through the four quarters was our main goal [against New Zealand]. We will need to play the same way against Spain," Harmanpreet said.

19.title: Who are the highest wicket-takers in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage?
19.article_body: Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga is the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage. Hasaranga took 15 wickets in eight matches for Sri Lanka, who've been eliminated in Super 12 stage. Hasaranga is followed by Netherlands' Bas de Leede (13), Zimbabwe's Blessing Muzarabani (12). Arshdeep Singh is India's highest wicket-taker with 10 wickets so far.

20.title: Never used term affair when I spoke about Karan Mehra & Charu: Rajeev
20.article_body: Rajeev Sen has said that he never used the term "affair" when he spoke about actor Karan Mehra and his estranged wife Charu Asopa. "I only said that Charu's mother disclosed to me through her voice note that her daughter is making reels with Karan...I didn't say anything against Karan. He has misunderstood my statement," he added.

21.title: Pak spending 66% of its forex reserves on fuel imports: Report
21.article_body: Pakistan is currently spending approximately $21.43 billion, or 66% of its total foreign exchange reserves, annually on fuel imports, The Express Tribune reported. This comes amid the global surge in energy prices and a faltering Pakistani economy. Notably, the delivered price of coal imported from South Africa has increased from $177/tonne to $407/tonne over the last year, the report said.

22.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage?
22.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli is the highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup 2022 so far with 246 runs in five innings. He's followed by Netherlands' Max O'Dowd, who scored 242 runs in eight innings. India's Suryakumar Yadav, who is featuring in his first-ever T20 World Cup, is third on the list with 225 runs.

23.title: Did you think you'd see a pic like this?: Bhogle on pic of Suryakumar's batting
23.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday took to Twitter to share a picture of India's Suryakumar Yadav while he was batting against Zimbabwe. Bhogle tweeted, "Did you think you would see a photograph like this?" He added, "Remember the old "spot the ball contest" days? How on earth would anyone know what's happening here and where the ball has ended up!"

24.title: Indian hackers' gang targeted critics of Qatar World Cup: UK news report
24.article_body: A gang of India-based computer hackers accessed files of journalists, politicians and critics of the FIFA World Cup 2022, scheduled to take place in Qatar in November, a British news report has claimed. The hacking was 'masterminded' by a 31-year-old accountancy firm employee based in India's Gurugram, the report claimed. Qatar has denied the allegations, calling them "patently false".

25.title: 2 hurt in crude bomb blast at under-construction building in Bengal
25.article_body: Two masons were injured in a crude bomb explosion at an under-construction building in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Sunday, according to police. Three live bombs were also recovered from the spot and were defused, an officer said. The owners of the house are being questioned and further investigation is underway, he added.

26.title: ICC names 11 great T20 World Cup upsets as Netherlands beat South Africa
26.article_body: ICC on Sunday named 11 great T20 World Cup upsets as Netherlands beat South Africa in T20 World Cup 2022 by 13 runs. Four out of the 11 upsets on the list came in 2022, including Netherlands' win over South Africa, Ireland's win over England and Zimbabwe's win over Pakistan. The list also features Ireland's win over Bangladesh in 2009.

27.title: Head teacher comes to Assam school carrying machete, suspended
27.article_body: The head teacher of a lower primary school in Assam's Cachar was suspended after he came to the institution with a machete. "The head teacher tried to hide the weapon...but we noticed fear amongst the students and other teachers," police said in a statement. According to state Education Department, he was trying to control other teachers by showing the machete.

28.title: iPhone users complain of glitches after iOS 16 update: Report
28.article_body: According to a report by 91Mobiles, after the new iOS 16 update on the iPhones, several users complained about various bugs and issues. Some iPhone 14 Pro users said that the phone display stopped responding, and iPhone 13 users complained that only a solid green screen was visible. Some complained that their devices even stopped working, the report added.

29.title: Kangana meets Assam CM, says 'An honour to get his support & encouragement'
29.article_body: Kangana Ranaut met Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma recently and shared pictures from her visit on her Instagram handle. The actress, who will be shooting for her next film 'Emergency' in Assam, wrote, "He extended his support for our team as we begin our outdoor schedule very soon in...Assam. Such an honour and privilege to get his support and encouragement."

30.title: It helped revive theatres: Rohit as 'Sooryavanshi' completes 1 year
30.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post marking one year since the release of 'Sooryavanshi'. "This film shall always be special for me! Not only because it helped revive the theatres...But also because it received unlimited love & support from...audience," he wrote. Rohit added that the film was the "biggest box office hit of 2021".

31.title: Makes me a proud Nana: Karan Johar on Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor's baby
31.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram and posted a picture with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt after the duo welcomed their first child together. "My heart is full of love...Welcome to the world baby girl...you have so much love waiting for you...So this makes me a proud Nana," Karan captioned his Instagram post. Ranbir and Alia recently featured in 'Brahmastra'.

32.title: Fan asks SRK if he will do a film with Vijay, actor says 'He's cool guy'
32.article_body: A fan on Twitter asked Shah Rukh Khan if he will do a film with South actor Vijay and further asked about his thoughts on the 'Master' actor. To this, he replied, "He's a really cool guy...films happen when they happen so...if they have to they will." This comes after filmmaker Atlee shared a picture with Shah Rukh and Vijay.

33.title: 15-yr-old boy kills 4 family members, buries their bodies in Tripura
33.article_body: A 15-year-old boy allegedly murdered four members of his family with an axe in a village in Tripura's Dhalai district, according to police. The bodies of the boy's grandfather, mother, 10-year-old sister and aunt were found buried in a pit near the courtyard of his house, police added. Police arrested the accused from Halahali on Sunday.

34.title: Jr NTR called me after watching 'Kantara', he appreciated me: Rishab
34.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty, who recently featured in 'Kantara', has revealed that 'RRR' actor Jr NTR called him after watching his film. "[Jr NTR] appreciated me a lot. So I really want to thank him," Rishab stated. Rishab has also directed and written 'Kantara'. The film has become the second-best Kannada film after 'KGF: Chapter 2' in terms of collection.

35.title: Bandits attack police camp in Pak; 7 officers killed, 20 abducted
35.article_body: Dozens of bandits in Pakistan's Sindh province stormed a police camp on Sunday, killing seven officers and kidnapping 20 others, local media reported. The incident reportedly took place in the Katcha area of the Ghotki district. The camp was purportedly established to carry out an operation for the release of several people kidnapped by the bandits a few days ago.

36.title: Four firms to float IPOs next week to raise ₹5,000 crore
36.article_body: Archean Chemical Industries, Five Star Business Finance, Kaynes Technology India and Inox Green Energy Services will float their initial public offerings next week to collectively raise about ₹5,000 crore. The IPOs of Archean Chemical and Five Star Business will be open for public subscription on November 9, while that of Kaynes Technology and Inox Green will open on November 10.

37.title: Miners trapped 620 ft underground live on coffee powder for 9 days in S Korea
37.article_body: Two South Korean miners who were rescued after being trapped 620 ft underground for nine days said they survived on instant coffee powder and water falling from the ceiling of a blocked shaft. The two men, aged 62 and 56, shared 30 sticks of instant coffee. They were stranded after a heap of earth clogged the entrance of the shaft.

38.title: Young India fan tackled by security after he invades field, Rohit runs to check on him
38.article_body: A young Team India fan was tackled by security after he invaded field during Zimbabwe's innings against India in their T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne on Sunday. A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma running towards the fan to check on him after he was tackled. The incident happened during the 17th over.

39.title: Dam in Kherson struck by Ukrainian missile: Russian media
39.article_body: The Nova Kakhovka dam in the Russian-controlled region of Kherson in Ukraine was damaged by a missile launched by Ukrainian forces, Russian media reported on Sunday. The dam blocks the Dnipro river upstream of Kherson where Ukrainian forces have been regaining lost territory. Since October, both Russia and Ukraine have repeatedly accused each other of planning to sabotage the dam.

40.title: Part of larger conspiracy: Murugha Mutt seer on rape allegations
40.article_body: Karnataka's Sri Murugha Mutt chief pontiff Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, accused of raping minor girls, has denied the allegations and called it "part of a larger conspiracy" against him, police said. Sharanaru was interrogated for over 12 hours over three days. He also refuted the allegations of being a father of many minor girls sheltered in the mutt's hostel, police added.

41.title: AAP is merely a part of UT Delhi, can't run Punjab: Ghulam Nabi Azad
41.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad on Sunday claimed AAP is merely a part of UT Delhi and can't run Punjab efficiently, adding that only Congress can challenge BJP in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. He added, "Although I have separated from Congress, I wasn't against their policy of secularism. It was only due to the party's system getting weakened."

42.title: Indian economy to grow 6.5-7% in medium term until 2030: CEA
42.article_body: India's Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) Dr V Anantha Nageswaran on Saturday said that the country's economy is poised to grow by 6.5 to 7% in the medium term until 2030. Asserting that it was too early to celebrate the success of the Indian economy, Nageswaran said, "We need to put our heads down and work, rather than celebrate prematurely."

43.title: Video shows mother, 2 daughters beating man, parading him with tied hands in MP
43.article_body: A mother and her two daughters beat a man up with slippers and paraded him with tied hands for allegedly molesting one of the daughters in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. A video of the incident shows the man being paraded through a market. The mother can be heard saying, "Look at him! He has molested a girl."

44.title: Cong reveals 22-point 'charge sheet' against Guj govt ahead of polls
44.article_body: Gujarat Congress released a 22-point 'charge sheet' against the state BJP government on Sunday ahead of the upcoming Assembly polls. Congress included the Morbi bridge collapse, which claimed over 130 lives in the charge sheet and dubbed the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano case as "unconstitutional".

45.title: Japan nuclear bombings show major cities needn't be attacked to win, said Putin: Report
45.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin mentioned the Hiroshima and Nagasaki atomic bombings in a conversation with French President Emmanuel Macron, leaving the latter "alarmed", the Daily Mail reported. "Putin [said] the bombings- which triggered the Japanese surrender and the end of the Second World War- demonstrated that 'you don't need to attack major cities in order to win'," the report added.

46.title: 11 detained in Hyderabad for selling illegal gas cylinders, oil
46.article_body: The Hyderabad police detained 10 persons and 1 history sheeter for illegally selling gas cylinders in the city. The police said they seized seven LPG cylinders, 65 liquor bottles and 45 bikes, which lacked supporting documents, after raiding the belt shop in the Chaderghat area. Police also seized 75 kg of adulterated oil in which animal carcasses were being used.

47.title: Gurugram will be made 'smartest city': Haryana CM Khattar
47.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that Gurugram will be turned into the "smartest city". "When our government came in 2014, GMDA was formed to...ensure that development schemes related to Gurugram are formulated," he said. Inaugurating a flyover at Basai Chowk and an underpass at Mahavir Chowk, CM Khattar said that it will help ease traffic movement in the city.

48.title: Govt notifies renaming Chandigarh International Airport after Bhagat Singh
48.article_body: The Centre has issued a notification renaming the Chandigarh International Airport as Shaheed Bhagat Singh International Airport. The announcement to rename the airport was done by PM Narendra Modi in September. The 115th birth anniversary of Bhagat Singh was celebrated on September 28.

49.title: SEBI settles 107 cases under settlement mechanism in FY22, collects ₹59 cr
49.article_body: SEBI said that it collected ₹58.81 crore towards settlement charges for 107 applications settled during the year, including ₹24.32 lakh towards settlement charges, and ₹37.54 lakh was recovered as legal charges. During 2021-22, SEBI received 345 applications for settlement, while 150 applications were pending at the beginning of the period. About 167 applications were rejected or withdrawn.

50.title: Indian startups most sought after in the world: Jitendra Singh
50.article_body: Minister of State for Science and Technology Jitendra Singh called Indian startups "the most sought after". Singh further stated that there has been a transformation in the space sector and currently over 102 startups are bringing great applications to develop rockets and satellites. He also said that India is helping other countries in satellite building.

51.title: BJP's Suryabanshi Suraj wins Dhamnagar bypoll in Odisha
51.article_body: BJP candidate Suryabanshi Suraj has won the bypoll in the Dhamnagar constituency in Odisha's Bhadrak district. Suraj secured 80,351 votes against Biju Janata Dal's Abanti Das and won by a margin of 9,881 votes. The Dhamnagar seat fell vacant following the death of BJP MLA Bishnu Charan Sethi in September.

52.title: TRS candidate wins Munugode bypoll in Telangana by 10,201 votes
52.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's party Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) has won the bypoll in the Munugode Assembly constituency by a margin of 10,201 votes. TRS candidate Koosukuntla Prabhakar Reddy was contesting the bypoll against BJP candidate Komatireddy Raj Gopal Reddy.

53.title: Centre's air quality panel lifts stage 4 of pollution action plan as Delhi's AQI improves
53.article_body: Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Sunday lifted stage 4 measures under the Graded Response Action Plan as Delhi's air quality index (AQI) improved to 'very poor' category. While lifting the measures, CAQM cited forecasts that said air quality will remain in the same category for next few days. All measures uptil stage 3 will remain enforced across Delhi-NCR.

54.title: Where in India will lunar eclipse's total phase be visible on Tuesday?
54.article_body: A total lunar eclipse will occur on November 8. The total phase of the eclipse will be visible in and around Agartala, Aizawl, Bhagalpur, Bhubaneswar, Cooch Behar, Cuttack, Darjeeling, Dibrugarh, Gangtok, Guwahati, Gaya, Hazaribagh, Imphal, Itanagar, Kohima, Kolkata, Midnapore, Murshidabad, Muzaffarpur, Patna, Port Blair, Puri, Ranchi, Shillong, Sibsagar, Silchar, Siliguri, Tamelong & Varanasi.

55.title: Twitter employee locked out of work emails at 3 am, says 'This isn't looking promising'
55.article_body: A Twitter employee named Chris Younie was locked out of his work e-mails amid Twitter layoffs after Elon Musk's takeover. "This isn't looking promising. Can't log into emails. Mac won't turn on," he tweeted. He also sarcastically tweeted, "But so grateful this is happening at 3 am. Really appreciate the thoughtfulness on the timing front guys."

56.title: Our little bean is here, I may never stop weeping: Alia's sister Shaheen
56.article_body: After Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor shared a statement announcing the birth of their baby girl, Alia's sister Shaheen Bhatt took to Instagram to express her happiness. "I may never stop weeping. Our little bean is finally here and life has forever changed," Shaheen wrote. Alia and Ranbir welcomed their first child on Sunday.

57.title: B'wood gets a lot of flak for VFX, we don't have that kind of money: Varun
57.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, who will next be seen in the horror-comedy film 'Bhediya', has said Bollywood gets a lot of flak for the quality of visual effects in films. "We, however, don't have that much money," he added. "In 'Bhediya', we have put in efforts within these limitations," Varun further said. The film is set to release on November 25.

58.title: PM 'pressuring' rebel BJP leader against contesting HP polls: Cong
58.article_body: Congress on Sunday accused PM Narendra Modi of "pressuring" a rebel BJP leader against contesting the Himachal Pradesh polls and alleged he is "misusing his power" to influence free and fair elections. Citing a video that is going viral on social media, Congress spokesperson Abhishek Manu Singhvi said that PM Modi has a "problematic priority list", which is distorted.

59.title: BJP calls AAP's Jain 'Vasooli Bhai', says he's running extortion racket from jail
59.article_body: BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Sunday called AAP's Satyendar Jain "Vasooli Bhai" and accused him of running an extortion racket from jail. Lekhi also demanded that Jain be shifted to a jail outside Delhi. "He even has a mobile phone and has Arvind Kejriwal's number saved as AK2," she said, adding that conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar is not joining BJP.

60.title: Daughters are indeed special: Mahesh Babu on Alia, Ranbir's baby
60.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu congratulated actress Alia Bhatt and actor Ranbir Kapoor on Instagram Stories on welcoming their first child together. Sharing Alia's post on his story, Mahesh wrote, "Daughters are indeed special! Congratulations Alia...Ranbir!" Alia had informed the birth of her baby girl through an Instagram post, which was captioned, "Our baby is here...what a magical girl she is."

61.title: Toilets have been provided at station: DMRC on video of man urinating on track
61.article_body: Responding to a video of a man urinating on Delhi Metro tracks, a senior official of DMRC said, "Toilets have been provided at the station for the use of passengers". In the purported video, the man can be heard saying, "Ho gaya, zyada ho gaya," on being asked, "Why are you urinating?"

62.title: Mumbai man jailed for rape gets bail; court says 'relationship was consensual'
62.article_body: A Mumbai special court has granted bail to a 19-year-old man accused of raping a 17-year-old girl. The court said, "[No] force appears to have been used by the accused for establishing sexual relations with...victim." It added that they were in a consensual relationship. The girl's mother had lodged a complaint after finding that her daughter was four months pregnant.

63.title: Bus blast kills 1 in Philippines; role of extortionists suspected
63.article_body: A homemade bomb exploded in a bus in Tacurong city of the Philippines on Sunday, reportedly killing one passenger and wounding 10 others. Authorities suspect the attack was linked to an alleged extortion attempt targeting the bus operator, Yellow Bus Line, which operates in key southern cities. A regional military official said the firm "has been constantly receiving extortion messages."

64.title: Won't go on endlessly with 'Avatar' franchise if it's not profitable: Director
64.article_body: Director James Cameron has said that he will not go on "endlessly" with the Avatar franchise if the upcoming instalments in the film are not profitable. "We're in a different world now than we were when I wrote this stuff...It's the one-two punch, the pandemic...streaming. Or...maybe we'll remind people what going to the theatre is all about," he added.

65.title: Hyderabad man arrested for forcing ex-wife to sleep with his friends
65.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a man who allegedly forced his ex-wife into prostitution after threatening to kill her. The man, according to the police complaint, forced his wife "to have sexual intercourse with his friends". The woman said she divorced the man in March but he continued to torture her, leading to her trying to die by suicide on November 2.

66.title: Technical textiles startups need to be encouraged: Piyush Goyal
66.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce, Industry and Textiles Piyush Goyal said that startups and scientists working in the technical textile industry must be encouraged. Goyal also asked Textile Research Associations (TRA) to submit proposals to the Ministry for support regarding state-of-the-art labs and modern machinery. He added that technical textiles needed to be brought into the mainstream.

67.title: 3 men pose as Income Tax officials, cheat Pune resident of ₹20 lakh
67.article_body: Police have arrested three men for cheating a Pune resident of ₹20 lakh, posing as Income Tax officials. The accused claimed they'd ₹40 lakh cash, which they wanted to exchange with him. Subsequently, the victim gave them ₹20 lakh, however, the accused cheated him by giving him ₹40 lakh in dummy currency with 'Bharatiya Bachhon ka Bank' printed on it.

68.title: Who will play whom in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals?
68.article_body: New Zealand and India topped T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 1 and Group 2, respectively, while England and Pakistan came second in their respective groups. New Zealand will face Pakistan in the first semi-final on November 9 (Wednesday). India will face England in the second semi-final on November 10 (Thursday).

69.title: It's a big day for dad, it's his 1st grandchild: Mahesh's son on Alia's baby
69.article_body: Rahul Bhatt, son of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, reacted to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor becoming parents to a baby girl and said, "I am overwhelmed." He added that his father Mahesh, who became a grandfather, is "most proud". "He is feeling the most proud because it's a big day for him. His first grandchild," Rahul further said.

70.title: Ban on construction activities as air quality turns 'severe' in Ghaziabad
70.article_body: Ghaziabad's local administration has banned private construction activities after the city's air quality turned "severe". The administration has imposed fines of up to ₹15 lakh for violators. "Post implementation of GRAP (Graded Response Action Plan)-3 in NCR, private construction activities are banned," an official said. The city recorded its first "severe" air quality day of 2022 on Thursday.

71.title: Nothing short of volcanic eruption: Mahesh on Alia-Ranbir's life after child's birth
71.article_body: Talking about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor following the birth of their daughter, filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, said, "They're quite overwhelmed by this life-altering moment." He added, "The way they're handling their entertainment career, doing a tightrope walk in between real life, and now with the birth of a child, it'll be nothing short of a volcanic eruption in their backyard."

72.title: Customs at Thiruvananthapuram Airport strip-searched my son: RS MP
72.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP PV Abdul Wahab has alleged that his son was strip-searched by Customs officials at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram Airport without due procedure on his return from UAE. "In view of the rising incident of gold smuggling through the airports, the agency has intensified its efforts to counter it," a Customs source said.

73.title: Income Tax department conducts survey at Jyothy Labs' offices, plant
73.article_body: Jyothy Labs said that the Income Tax department conducted a survey at the company's offices and manufacturing plant under Section 133A of the Income Tax Act, 1961, in the normal course of business. The company added that it extended its full co-operation and support to the officials and have provided them timely and correct information as asked.

74.title: Rishi Kapoor's blessings are with Alia-Ranbir's baby girl: Randhir
74.article_body: As Ranbir Kapoor-Alia Bhatt welcomed their first child, Randhir Kapoor remembered his late brother Rishi Kapoor and said that he "would've been really proud" about becoming a grandfather again. "I'm sure his blessings are with the baby girl and the entire family," he said, adding that the families "will have a huge celebration" after Alia and the newborn return home.

75.title: 'Adipurush' makers to re-work on VFX, film likely to get delayed: Reports
75.article_body: The makers of 'Adipurush' are reportedly planning to postpone its release date. Film trade analyst Girish Johar tweeted, "'Adipurush' is being reworked...especially the effects and CGI work...so it may not...release in Summer 2023. Additionally, it may now cost ₹80-100 crore more." Following the release of the film's teaser, several people on social media criticised the makers for its VFX.

76.title: Mumbai Police arrest 2 men for stealing cars using app
76.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested two men for allegedly stealing vehicles from an app-based car renting service. The accused, Dinesh (25) and Suresh (28), used to book cars through fake profiles, drive them to Rajasthan, and later sell them by removing the GPS system, police said. Multiple complaints have been registered against them in various police stations across Maharashtra, Delhi and Gujarat.

77.title: Pope visits Gulf's oldest Catholic church on last day of Bahrain trip
77.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday concluded his four-day trip to Bahrain with a visit to the Sacred Heart Church, the Gulf's oldest Catholic church. During his visit, the pope asked bishops, priests and nuns to remain united as they minister to Catholics in the Muslim-majority region. The Sacred Heart Church is one of the only two Catholic churches in Bahrain.

78.title: 5 dead in suicide bomb blast at Somali military training camp
78.article_body: At least five people were killed and 11 others were wounded after a suicide bomber detonated explosives at the front gate of a military training camp in Somalia's Mogadishu on Saturday, military officers said. The extremist group al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for the attack. The bomber had pretended to be a recruit, Somalia's defence forces chief told state media.

79.title: Don't know why directors don't give me dancing roles: Huma Qureshi
79.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi has said that she does not know why directors don't offer her "dancing roles" in films. "I love dancing...I have not been given opportunities to dance. I would love to do such roles," she added. Huma will next be seen in 'Monica, O My Darling'. The film also features Rajkummar Rao and Radhika Apte.

80.title: Mumbai designer abducted by 4 for failing to pay money, rescued
80.article_body: Mumbai Police rescued a 43-year-old designer from Gujarat, who had been abducted by four people after he failed to pay ₹6 lakh for a stitching assignment, an official said on Saturday. The victim was abducted from Malad on November 3 and taken to Gujarat in an SUV, police said. The designer and accused knew each other, reports said.

81.title: 82-year-old former IB officer run over by car without number plate in Mysuru
81.article_body: A video has surfaced showing 82-year-old former Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer RK Kulkarni being run over by a car without number plates in Karnataka's Mysuru. Kulkarni was killed after being hit by a car on November 4 at 5:30 pm in Manasa Gangotri, according to police. "It was not an accident but murder," police added.

82.title: Accenture fires employees with fake experience letters in India
82.article_body: Accenture's India unit fired several employees for using documentation and experience letters from fraudulent companies to obtain job offers from Accenture. Confirming the development, Accenture told The Hindu, "We have exited people who we confirmed took advantage of this scheme." According to Twitter conversations, Accenture may have let go of 'thousands' of employees, The Hindu reported.

83.title: If Lokesh Kanagaraj offered me role, I'd 100% love to do it: Varun Dhawan
83.article_body: Varun Dhawan said he'd "100% love to do a Tamil film" if director Lokesh Kanagaraj offers him a role. Varun also revealed that he has received "decent" offers from Tamil and Telugu film industries. "People can divide us but...it's a good time to be more collaborative. Cinema in general is going through a big transition at the moment," he added.

84.title: India emerged as a strong nation under PM Modi's leadership: Shah
84.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Home Minister Amit Shah said that under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, India emerged as a strong nation in the world. He said, "With surgical and air strikes on Pakistan, PM Modi avenged Uri and Pulwama attacks and conveyed...to world that one has to pay a price for messing with India and its borders."

85.title: BJP will win both upper and lower parts of Himachal Pradesh: Amit Shah
85.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah exuded confidence that the BJP will win the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, scheduled to take place on November 12. He claimed that the party will win both the lower and upper parts of the state. He also alleged that the Congress party was involved in corruption during its tenure.

86.title: BankBazaar to turn profitable in FY23, to go for IPO next year: CEO
86.article_body: BankBazaar Founder and CEO Adhil Shetty said the company expects to turn profitable this fiscal and plans to file for an IPO by the end of next year. "We have delivered 85% year-on-year top-line growth in Q2FY23 and had annualised revenue of ₹170 crore in Q2," he mentioned. "In both August and September, we were EBITDA positive," Shetty said.

87.title: K'taka MLA Renukacharya alleges negligence in probe into nephew's death
87.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA M P Renukacharya has alleged negligence in the probe into nephew Chandrashekar's death. Chandrashekar was found dead inside a car that had fallen into a canal, days after he went missing. Police have filed a murder case after Chandrashekar's father suspected that he was tortured and murdered.

88.title: Congress doesn't believe in its own manifesto: BJP chief JP Nadda
88.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised the Congress and said that the party doesn't believe in its own manifesto. He further added that Congress' manifesto has no vision. "[Congress' manifesto has] no weightage and direction...Our manifesto is done with due diligence and is taken seriously by [citizens]...People are excited and are blessing our campaign," said Nadda.

89.title: Man arrested for rubber sheet theft in Kerala after 37 years
89.article_body: A man was arrested by police 37 years after he stole a rubber sheet from Kerala's Vechoochira village in Pathanamthitta district and then went into hiding in a nearby forest area. The accused had gone into hiding right after the incident in 1985 and neither his relatives nor villagers knew where he was, an official statement read.

90.title: 4 doctors of Gurugram hospital booked over 22-yr-old UK citizen's death
90.article_body: Four doctors of a private hospital in Gurugram have been booked over the death of a 22-year-old UK citizen, officials said. Despite several tests, doctors couldn't ascertain why the deceased's lungs were filling up with blood, his father said in a complaint, adding that the doctors administered heavy direct current shocks and resumed cardiopulmonary resuscitation.

91.title: PM undermining basis of constituency-based parliamentary democracy: Chidambaram
91.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi is "undermining the very basis of a constituency-based Parliamentary democracy". "The PM said that the voters need not remember the name of the candidate in the constituency. PM also said 'Vote for the lotus, it is a vote for Modi'," Chidambaram tweeted.

92.title: No place for impersonating CM's photo in Thackeray memorial: Uddhav
92.article_body: The Balasaheb Thackeray's National Memorial, which is coming up at Mayor's Bungalow in Mumbai, will have photos of Shiv Sena CMs except the impersonated CM, said Uddhav Thackeray. "By the time the memorial is ready, there could be a photo of Shiv Sena PM," he added. The first phase of the memorial will be ready by May 2023, he said.

93.title: UP BJP MP gets threat call from Mumbai; caller threatens to kill her, family
93.article_body: BJP MP from Phulpur, Keshari Devi Patel, received a death threat over phone, reports said. According to primary surveillance, the call was made from Mumbai. The caller reportedly hurled abuses at her and demanded to be paid ₹50 lakh. The caller threatened her by saying if the money was not paid then she and her whole family would be murdered.

94.title: India record most wins in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022, finish top of the table
94.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by 71 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Sunday. India recorded most victories in the Super 12 stage of the tournament across both the groups, with four wins in five matches. India finished top of the Group 2 points table, followed by Pakistan, South Africa, Netherlands, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe.

95.title: Infosys still operating in Russia, 8 months after saying it was shutting ops: Report
95.article_body: Infosys is still operating in Moscow, eight months after saying that it was shutting operations over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, as per a report. The company has reportedly been paying subcontractors in Moscow to carry out IT services for a global client. Notably, UK PM Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty receives annual dividends from her 0.91% stake in Infosys.

96.title: Record ₹30.88 lakh crore cash with public 6 years after demonetisation
96.article_body: The currency with the public for the fortnight that ended October 21, 2022, stood at a record high of ₹30.88 lakh crore. The figure is up 72% from the ₹17.97 lakh crore cash with the public on November 4, 2016. The latest figure comes six years after the government announced demonetisation in which old ₹500 and ₹1,000 notes were withdrawn.

97.title: Too much western influence in B'wood, why're you trying that?: Rishab
97.article_body: 'Kantara' actor Rishab Shetty has said that there's "too much" western influence in Bollywood. "Why are you trying that? People are already getting that in Hollywood, and they are doing it better in terms of quality, storytelling and performances," he added. Rishab's directorial 'Kantara' has become the second-best Kannada film after 'KGF: Chapter 2' in terms of box office collection.

98.title: Woman strangles 13-yr-old daughter to death in Rajasthan; arrested
98.article_body: A woman was arrested after she allegedly strangled her 13-year-old daughter to death in Rajasthan's Baran. The woman's 11-year-old son, who witnessed the incident, reportedly screamed on seeing the act, following which neighbours broke the door to enter the house. The family claimed that the woman had depression and used to suddenly get annoyed with the children and beat them.

99.title: Keep the highlights, watch them again & again: Harsha on Suryakumar's 61*
99.article_body: Discussing Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 61 off 25 balls in Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Keep the highlights...Watch them again and again." "You can scarcely believe that kind of finish...Very few in T20 cricket have batted like Suryakumar is batting now," added Harsha. Suryakumar's 61* comprised six fours and four sixes.

100.title: Tirupati temple trust has over 10 tonnes of gold, ₹15,938 cr in cash
100.article_body: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) released a white paper on Saturday and declared the list of its assets including fixed deposits and gold deposits. It has a cash deposit of ₹15,938 crore. The temple trust said that it has 10.3 tonnes of gold deposits in nationalised banks worth more than ₹5,300 crore.

101.title: Karnataka resident makes special Banarasi turban for PM Modi
101.article_body: A resident of Karnataka's Mysuru has made a special turban for PM Narendra Modi, who will inaugurate a 108-feet-tall Kempegowda statue at the Bengaluru airport next week. The turban was presented to CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday. The dark pink turban is specially made with the famous Banarasi cloth and decorated with accessories.

102.title: Once Musk called me up at 3 am & asked me where I was: SpaceX's former exec
102.article_body: Jim Cantrell, a former SpaceX executive, said, "One time, he (Elon Musk) called me up at 3 am demanding to know where I was because he was in the office." Cantrell said, "I told him 'I went to bed three hours ago — I need more sleep'." He added, "Musk wanted me to get down there for work."

103.title: It's all bulls**t: Yash on claims that Bollywood is nearing end
103.article_body: Kannada actor Yash said that he finds the claims "bulls**t" that Bollywood is nearing its end. Yash added that with KGF's success, he cannot think of himself as the biggest star as "every Friday you've to prove yourself". He further added that the "tables will turn" when someone does better work, which will get accepted by audiences across the country.

104.title: A rat was treated better than me on 'Mili' sets, jokes Janhvi Kapoor
104.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor jokingly said that rat was treated better than her on the 'Mili' sets. She added, "When the rat came, it was the star of this set. Everybody was like...'We'll have to cut because...rat needs to relax'. I was like the rat needs to relax? Your actor is dying!" 'Mili' is a remake of the Malayalam film 'Helen'.

105.title: BJP wins big, AAP loses deposit, Congress is on Yatra: Malviya on bypolls
105.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya, while talking about bypolls that were held in six states on Thursday, said that his party continues to win big. "BJP's Smt Kusum Devi wins Gopalganj in Bihar against Nitish Kumar-Lalu Prasad 'Mahagathbandhan'...Shri Aman Giri wins Gola Gokarannath in UP...Shri Bhavya Bishnoi wins Adampur in Haryana...AAP loses deposit. Congress is on Yatra," he wrote on Twitter.

106.title: Working with Elon was like working with two different people: SpaceX's former exec
106.article_body: Jim Cantrell, who worked with SpaceX in its earliest days, told Business Insider, "Working with Elon Musk was like working with two different people: the good Elon and the bad Elon, and you never knew which you were going to get." He said, "The good Elon is very funny and charming." He added, "The bad Elon would yell at you."

107.title: Residents oppose one-way road plan in Pune's Viman Nagar
107.article_body: Residents and activists in Pune's Viman Nagar have opposed a plan to make roads one-way in the area. According to the plan, the roads from Dorabjee mall to Ganapati temple Chowk and from Shri Krishna Chowk to CCD Junction in Viman Nagar will be turned into one-way routes. A resident of the area said that the plan will inconvenience people.

108.title: Serbs in northern Kosovo quit govt jobs over license plate row
108.article_body: Members of the minority Serb community in northern Kosovo on Saturday resigned en masse from their jobs with state institutions to protest the government's order to swap license plates issued by Serbia with Kosovo plates. The long-running row is a point of contention between Serbia and Kosovo, a former Serbian province. The Serb minority in Kosovo is backed by Serbia.

109.title: Tariffs are 'unsustainable', price correction needed: Vodafone Idea CEO
109.article_body: Vodafone Idea (VIL) CEO Akshaya Moondra said telecom tariffs in India are at unsustainable levels, and the industry needs tariff correction to support continued investments. He added that the company has taken several tariff interventions, including for entry-level plans, over the last year. He mentioned that VIL continues to focus on getting more customers on 4G and unlimited plans.

110.title: Govt asks sugar mills to export speedily to clear farmers' dues
110.article_body: The government of India released a notification asking sugar mills to export their production speedily to clear farmers' cane dues quickly. The government allocated a uniform export quota of 18.23% of the three years' average production in operational sugar seasons. The notification said sugar mills can export themselves or through exporters or swap with domestic sale quota of other mills.

111.title: Himachal government committed to implementing UCC: CM Jairam Thakur
111.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, CM Jairam Thakur claimed that the government is committed to implementing the Uniform Civil Code and called it a necessity. "There are technical aspects, but a committee will be constituted. We'll go ahead on the path that will come out," said Thakur. The state will vote on November 12.

112.title: Man accused of harassing woman dies in accident while trying to escape police
112.article_body: A 22-year-old auto driver accused of harassing a woman died in a road accident in Delhi. He was trying to escape from the police when he got hit by a vehicle and succumbed to the injuries later. According to the police, the 40-year-old woman had complained that the deceased molested and misbehaved with her at a metro station on Saturday.

113.title: PM Modi turned global pandemic into an opportunity: MoS Rajeev Chandrasekhar
113.article_body: Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar hailed PM Narendra Modi's vision for a new India and said that he turned the global pandemic into an opportunity. "The last eight years of [his] leadership have transformed India in many areas. Before 2014, India was looked at as a country with policy paralysis," said Chandrasekhar.

114.title: MMRDA plans to open Thane's Kopri ROB on Eastern Express within 3 months
114.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) plans to open Kopri ROB on the Eastern Express Highway in Thane in the next three months. "Eastern Express Highway commuters will soon get relief," an official said adding that 85% of work is completed. MMRDA is upgrading the 2+2 lane bridge to 4+4 in order to decongest traffic.

115.title: Pak Senator breaks down over fake 'obscene' video of him & wife
115.article_body: A video of Pakistani Senator Azam Khan Swati breaking down before reporters over his wife allegedly receiving a video from an unknown number featuring him and her has surfaced online. Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency said that prima facie, the "obscene" video of Swati is "fake". Swati said that he couldn't share details about video as "daughters...of [his] country are listening".

116.title: Kohli would've done equally well against the WI team of 70s, 80s: Hughes
116.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Kim Hughes said Virat Kohli would've been as successful against the West Indies team which featured during the 1970s and 1980s. "He'd do well in any era," added Hughes. Talking about the 1970s and 1980s, Hughes stated, "[The] only batter...[capable of hitting] a pacer for six over extra cover consistently was Vivian Richards...Now even...[a] nine-year-old...[can] hit a six."

117.title: JD(U) made alliance with RJD still couldn't defeat BJP in Goplaganj: Shahnawaz
117.article_body: Reacting to BJP candidate Kusum Devi's victory from Bihar's Gopalganj seat in by-polls, Shahnawaz Hussain said that JD(U) severed ties with BJP and went to RJD but still couldn't defeat BJP. "Clear message that even together they can't defeat BJP. Their victory margin went down in Mokama. It shows the future is BJP's," he added.

118.title: Asthma cases surge among children in Delhi amid rising pollution
118.article_body: Cases of asthma and respiratory issues among children in Delhi have doubled as compared to last month, doctors said. "Pollution, cold exposure, change in the season, and passive smoking have aggravated asthma in these children," a doctor said. There are a number of factors responsible and pollution is one of them, a doctor added.

119.title: Italy allows 1 of 4 migrant rescue ships stranded at sea to dock
119.article_body: One of the four migrant rescue ships stranded near Italy's waters was allowed to dock at the Catania port on Sunday. Humanity 1 had been stranded at sea with 179 people, including 100 unaccompanied minors. Italy has said the ship would be allowed in its waters only long enough to disembark minors and provide medical care to those in need.

120.title: 2 men on scooty snatch woman's phone on Delhi road, video surfaces
120.article_body: Two men on a scooty snatched a woman's mobile phone in Delhi. A video of the incident surfaced online. Reports said that the incident took place outside NKS Hospital in Delhi. "Efforts were made to contact the victim but she is not traceable so far," police said. Police added that efforts are also being made to catch the accused.

121.title: Ex-IB officer dies in road accident in K'taka, police suspect murder
121.article_body: Police suspect that the 82-year-old former Intelligence Bureau officer, who was believed to have died in a road accident inside the campus of Mysore University, was actually murdered. An unidentified vehicle had hit the officer from behind. After going through the CCTV footage, the police have said that a murder case has been registered.

122.title: Anurag Kashyap meets Dalai Lama at Dharamshala Int'l Film Fest, shares pic
122.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap met the Dalai Lama at the Dharamshala International Film Festival on Saturday. He took to Instagram to share a picture with the Tibetan spiritual leader and wrote, "This happened today," with a heart emoji. Anurag, along with writer Varun Grover and filmmakers Rintu Thomas and Sushmit Ghosh, hosted masterclasses and panel discussions at the film festival.

123.title: Deepika, Kareena & others congratulate Alia-Ranbir on becoming parents
123.article_body: Deepika Padukone congratulated Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt for becoming parents to a baby girl, while Kareena Kapoor Khan mentioned she "can't wait to meet mini Alia". Akshay Kumar wrote, "No bigger joy in the world than to have a daughter," and Sonam Kapoor commented, "Cannot wait to see your princess". Anushka Sharma sent blessings to the newborn.

124.title: Poor umpiring decision: Aakash Chopra on Shakib's dismissal vs Pak
124.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra took to Twitter to term Shakib Al Hasan's dismissal having been declared LBW out in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh as a "poor umpiring decision". "There was a spike. It couldn't have been anything else except the ball hitting the bat," added Aakash. Shakib refused to go off after being declared out.

125.title: India record their highest-ever total against Zimbabwe in T20I cricket
125.article_body: India on Sunday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against Zimbabwe after registering 186/5 in 20 overs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne. India's previous highest T20I total against Zimbabwe had come on July 17, 2015, when they recorded 178/5 in Harare. Suryakumar Yadav top-scored for India today with 61*(25).

126.title: Non-use of helmets caused 157 deaths in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad
126.article_body: In Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, 157 deaths have been reported due to non-use of helmets from January to September this year. According to data from the traffic police department, Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) recorded 765 accidents between the same period. In PCMC, only five per cent of riders use helmets, Anand Bhoite, DCP, Traffic Department, said.

127.title: Betting addicted ex-prof robs gold chain from senior citizen in B'luru
127.article_body: A former assistant professor, who was addicted to betting, was arrested on Saturday for allegedly breaking into a house in Bengaluru and stealing a gold chain from a senior citizen, police said. The accused had parked a stolen gearless scooter near the victim's house, which helped in tracking him down, investigators said.

128.title: Pathankot only district in Punjab with no farm fire this season: Official
128.article_body: Pathankot is the only district in Punjab which has not seen a single farm fire so far this season. Pathankot Chief Agricultural Officer Amrik Singh said, "We had set a target this season that there should be no stubble burning incident in the district and so far, no such incident has been reported."

129.title: Video shows B'luru policeman, RWA member trading blows over water & power cut
129.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, a police sub-inspector and a Resident Welfare Association (RWA) member were seen trading blows in Bengaluru over the cutting of water and power supply. A flat owner called the police after his power and water supply was cut, following which a scuffle broke out between the policeman and the RWA member.

130.title: Pune man given drug-laced coffee, kidnapped, murdered for gold jewellery
130.article_body: A 43-year-old 'Vastushastra' consultant was allegedly kidnapped and murdered by two men, including his friend, for his gold jewellery in Pune, the police said. The accused took the victim to a religious function on the pretext of performing a 'Vastu' puja and gave him drug-laced coffee. They strangled him to death and dumped his body in the Nira river.

131.title: Release of 'Kushi' pushed to 2023 due to bunch of reasons: Vijay
131.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has shared that his film 'Kushi' with Samantha Ruth Prabhu "has been pushed to next year due to a bunch of reasons". The actor said that the film, which was earlier scheduled to release on December 23, is eyeing for a February 2023 release. "We have finished close to 60% of the shoot," he added.

132.title: It feels like home when he is around: Janhvi on rumoured boyfriend Orhan
132.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor in an interview spoke about her rumoured boyfriend Orhan Awatramani and said that it "feels like home when he is around". "I've known [Orhan] for years now...I trust him a lot. I think it's rare to find friends who'll stand up for you the way he stands up for his friends...He's a great guy," the actress added.

133.title: Plane crashes into Lake Victoria in Tanzania; rescue ops underway
133.article_body: Rescue operations are underway after a Precision Air passenger plane crashed into the Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake, in Tanzania on Sunday, the country's state media Tanzanian Broadcasting Corporation (TBC) reported. The TBC said that while the number of passengers on board the plane is not known, at least 15 people have been rescued so far.

134.title: Aditya Chopra, Karan Johar brought in NRI phase in Bollywood: Barjatya
134.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya said that there was a phase of films showcasing love stories when he made 'Maine Pyar Kiya', featuring Salman Khan. "With 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun' the whole family culture came in. Then Adi and Karan (filmmakers Aditya Chopra and Karan Johar) brought in the NRI phase," he added. Sooraj's upcoming directorial 'Uunchai' will release on November 11.

135.title: Kerala govt to reimburse upto ₹10 lakh tech licence cost to startups
135.article_body: The Kerala government launched a scheme under the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) to reimburse upto ₹10 lakh to startups procuring technology licenses from government research institutions. As part of the scheme, 90% of the fee would be refunded to the startups. "This..scheme..will encourage startups to innovate on their ideas without bothering about the cost involved," KSUM CEO, Anoop Ambika said.

136.title: Gujarat court sends 4 accused to judicial custody in Morbi bridge collapse case
136.article_body: Two managers of the Oreva group and two contractors accused in the Morbi bridge collapse were sent to judicial custody after a magistrate court refused further police remand. The police, in their remand application, said that the company was not qualified for the renovation of the 140-year-old bridge. As many as 135 people were killed in the incident.

137.title: Suryakumar creates history, becomes 1st Indian to score 1,000 T20I runs in a year
137.article_body: Suryakumar Yadav today created history by becoming the first-ever India batter to score 1,000 T20I runs in a calendar year. The 32-year-old reached the 1,000-run mark in T20Is in 2022 during his innings against Zimbabwe in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Overall, he's the second batter after Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan to score 1,000 T20I runs in a calendar year.

138.title: '4 yaar doing bhrashtachar in jail': BJP on Kejriwal, Jain, Gahlot & conman Sukesh
138.article_body: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla on Saturday said that Arvind Kejriwal, Satyendar Jain, Kailash Gahlot and Sukesh Chandrashekhar are "chaar yaar" doing bhrashtachar in jail. BJP's Amit Malviya tweeted images of a letter written by Sukesh, alleging that Kejriwal threatened him through jail authorities, offered a Rajya Sabha seat for money and attended a party with Jain.

139.title: Police seize over 6,000 liquor bottles in Tamil Nadu's Madurai
139.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police seized over six thousand liquor bottles kept in a private club in Madurai. The police registered a case and arrested the manager of the club, Maharajan. A preliminary investigation revealed that the club's owner, Panaselvam, and staff members were selling these bottles to customers during non-functioning hours at higher rates.

140.title: Pune doctor delivered 2,400 baby girls in last 11 years without charging fees
140.article_body: With a mission to save the girl child, a doctor from Pune waives off the fees when a baby girl is born in his hospital in the Hadapsar area. Dr Ganesh Rakh claims to have delivered over 2,400 girl children in the last 11 years without charging fees from their parents and relatives. Dr Rakh runs a maternity-cum-multispeciality hospital.

141.title: Defeat vs Netherlands definitely among the worst defeats as coach: Boucher
141.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said that their defeat against Netherlands on Sunday in the T20 World Cup was among the worst defeats in his coaching career. "If you look at the game as a whole, I think Netherlands out-bowled us," stated Boucher. Batting first, Netherlands posted 158/4 and then restricted South Africa to 145/8.

142.title: Foreign investors invest ₹15,280 cr in equities in November first week
142.article_body: After withdrawing funds in the last two months, Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) invested ₹15,280 crore in equities during November 1-4, according to data with depositories. This came following a net outflow of just ₹8 crore last month and ₹7,624 crore in September. The total outflow so far this year by FPIs in equities has reached ₹1.53 lakh crore.

143.title: Our collective cup runneth over: Alia's mother Soni Razdan on becoming grandmother
143.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan, who became a grandmother after Alia and Ranbir Kapoor welcomed a baby girl on Sunday, wrote on Instagram, "Oh happy day!" She added, "Thank you all for your wishes of love. Our collective cup runneth over." She also said, "So much gratitude to life for this amazing wonderful blessing of a gift."

144.title: Netherlands player who took David Miller's catch was born in SA, played 2 T20 WCs for SA
144.article_body: Netherlands all-rounder Roelof van der Merwe, who took South Africa's David Miller's catch in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, was born in Johannesburg. He earlier represented South Africa and featured in two T20 World Cups for them. He took Miller's catch running backwards, when South Africa needed 47 runs to win off 29 deliveries. Netherlands won by 13 runs.

145.title: Paying amount to maintain account will build Twitter's integrity: Kangana
145.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and called Twitter the best social media platform right now. "Paying a certain amount to maintain a Twitter account will only help it build its integrity," she further wrote. She added, "There are no free lunches in this world, have you ever thought, all these platforms...you access freely, how do they sustain themselves?"

146.title: Bangladesh missed a trick by dismissing him: Ganesh on Babar's 25(33)
146.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said Bangladesh "missed a trick" by dismissing Babar Azam for 25(33) during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh. Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to urge Babar to bat at number three following the match which Pakistan won by five wickets. "You should be...flexible...[with regard to the]...batting line-up," added Afridi.

147.title: Geo-fencing restrictions for booking Mumbai locals tickets likely to be removed: Report
147.article_body: The railway authorities are planning to remove the geo-fencing restrictions in the mobile app Unreserved Ticketing System (UTS) to facilitate remote digital ticketing for the suburban local train service, reports said. Currently, tickets through UTS app can only be booked if the user is at least 30 metres away from tracks and within two kilometres of a requested boarding station.

148.title: Fire breaks out in apartment building in New York; 38 injured
148.article_body: At least 38 people were injured after a fire broke out in a high-rise apartment building in New York's Manhattan on Saturday, fire officials said. The New York City Fire Department Commissioner said that the blaze started in an apartment on the 20th-floor from a lithium battery. Videos of the incident showed firefighters rescuing people from the building.

149.title: Rutuja Latke of Uddhav-led Sena faction wins Andheri East seat in Maharashtra bypolls
149.article_body: Rutuja Latke of Uddhav-led Sena faction has won the Andheri East assembly seat in the Maharashtra bypolls. Latke won the seat after defeating six other candidates who competed against her. The bypoll was necessitated due to the death of Rutuja Latke's husband Ramesh Latke in May this year. He was a sitting Shiv Sena MLA.

150.title: Mumbai bank asked to pay ₹3 lakh to couple for misplacing loan docs
150.article_body: A District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has ordered the ICICI Bank in Mumbai to compensate an NRI couple for misplacing their loan documents. The bank has been asked to pay the couple ₹3.78 lakh that they paid while transferring their loan from ICICI to SBI. The amount will be paid with 7% interest from 2010 till the date of realisation.

151.title: Passenger plane crashes into Lake Victoria in Tanzania, video surfaces
151.article_body: A Precision Air plane plunged into Lake Victoria in Tanzania on Sunday due to bad weather shortly before landing in the northwestern city of Bukoba, police said. Reports said nearly 50 people were on the flight. A video footage that circulated online showed the plane almost fully submerged, with only its green and brown-coloured tail visible above the water line.

152.title: Can't wait to see the newborn: Riddhima on Alia-Ranbir's baby
152.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni said she "can't wait to see" her brother and Alia Bhatt's newborn baby. "We are all very excited in the family. My mom will FaceTime me the minute she sees her. I am so happy," she said. Sharing Alia-Ranbir's statement on her Instagram account, Soni Razdan wrote, "Our hearts are overflowing and overwhelmed."

153.title: Twitter's $8 charge for verification not a good idea: Dogecoin Co-creator
153.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus has said Twitter charging $8 for blue tick verification badges is not a good idea, basing it on what he has heard about its implementation. "Too many big changes too quickly can terminally destroy a platform," he added. Elon Musk replied to Markus, saying, "Far too many legacy 'verified' checkmarks were handed out, often arbitrarily."

154.title: Musk's Boring Company shares image of full-scale Hyperloop test
154.article_body: Elon Musk's The Boring Company took to Twitter to share a picture of a Tesla sedan inside a "full-scale Hyperloop" test tunnel.  This comes after Bloomberg reported that SpaceX has dismantled the roughly one-mile-long Hyperloop test tunnel near its headquarters in Hawthorne, California. The report added that the project has been indefinitely shelved.

155.title: 'Elon, please get off Twitter,' says actor Mark Ruffalo; Musk responds
155.article_body: Retweeting US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's tweet that criticised Elon Musk, actor Mark Ruffalo asked Musk to "please get off Twitter". He wrote, "Hand the keys over to someone who does this as an actual job, and get on with running Tesla and SpaceX. You are destroying your credibility." Meanwhile, Musk replied, "Hot take: not everything AOC says is accurate."

156.title: Shahid Afridi urges Babar Azam to not open, says 'We need firepower at the top'
156.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has urged Babar Azam to not open. He tweeted, "Babar...we need firepower at the top with batters who're showing clear intent like Muhammad Haris and Shadab Khan." He added, "Please consider Haris opening with Muhammad Rizwan and you one down...followed by your next best hitter. You should be rigid on winning...and flexible on...balanced batting line-up."

157.title: I own the responsibility, I grew Twitter too quickly: Co-founder amid layoffs
157.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey apologised for the layoffs at the company after Elon Musk's takeover and tweeted, "I own the responsibility for why everyone is in this situation: I grew the company size too quickly." He added, "I apologize for that." The Twitter Co-founder also tweeted, "I am grateful for, and love, everyone who has ever worked on Twitter."

158.title: Taylor Swift is my only true friend in the industry: Selena
158.article_body: Singer-actress Selena Gomez called Taylor Swift her "only true Hollywood friend". She also admitted that she had a hard time fitting in with the "cool group" of celebrities as she struggled with her identity. In her documentary 'My Mind & Me', Selena opened up about her battle with psychosis, which eventually led her to being diagnosed with bipolar disorder.

159.title: BJP's Bhavya Bishnoi wins Adampur in Haryana bypolls, retains seat vacated by father
159.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Bhavya Bishnoi has won the Adampur seat in the Haryana bypolls on Sunday. With this, he has retained the seat vacated by his father Kuldeep Bishnoi. Bishnoi won the seat by defeating Indian National Congress' Jai Parkash. Bishnoi's father had resigned as MLA and switched from the Congress to the BJP in August.

160.title: UP man beaten to death for stealing guava from orchard, 2 arrested
160.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was beaten to death in UP's Aligarh for allegedly stealing guava from an orchard. Two people have been arrested so far, the police said. According to the victim's brother, the man picked up guava while returning from the forest and seeing the fruit in his hand some guards protecting the orchard attacked him, reports said.

161.title: Bengaluru man loses ₹26,000, iPhone & car key in honey trap; woman arrested
161.article_body: Karnataka police arrested a woman on Sunday and launched a hunt for four male gang members after a man in Bengaluru was allegedly honey-trapped by them. The victim was at the woman's house when the four men came in and threatened him with a knife. The gang extorted ₹26,000 through online transfer and snatched the man's iPhone and car key.

162.title: Bank holiday announced in UK to mark coronation of King Charles III
162.article_body: UK PM Rishi Sunak has announced a bank holiday on May 8 next year across the country to mark the coronation of King Charles III. The coronation will take place on May 6 next year. A bank holiday was also declared to mark the coronation of the late Queen Elizabeth II in 1953. Sunak called the occasion "historic".

163.title: BJP's Aman Giri wins UP's Gola Gokarannath Assembly bypolls, retains late father's seat
163.article_body: BJP candidate Aman Giri has won Gola Gokarannath Assembly bypolls (Lakhimpur Kheri seat) on Sunday, retaining the seat of his father and late BJP MLA Arvind Giri. He defeated Samajwadi Party's Vinay Tiwari by over 34,000 votes, an official said. After winning the elections, Giri said he would fulfil the dream of his father and ensure the development of constituency.

164.title: SA's tryst with World Cup is like Hindi movie tragedies from 1950s & 1960s: Harsha Bhogle
164.article_body: Reacting to South Africa getting knocked out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing to Netherlands in Super 12 stage, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Their tryst with...World Cup is like one of those Hindi movie tragedies from...50s and 60s...And there doesn't seem to be a happy ending in...last scene!" Notably, South Africa have never won ODI or T20 World Cup.

165.title: Shaheen Afridi records his best-ever bowling figures in T20I cricket
165.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi on Sunday recorded his best-ever bowling figures in T20I cricket. The 22-year-old registered figures of 4-0-22-4 against Bangladesh in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. His previous best figures came on November 3, when he took three wickets for 14 runs in three overs against South Africa.

166.title: RJD’s Neelam Devi wins in Bihar's Mokama, BJP's Kusum Devi bags Gopalganj seat
166.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal's Neelam Devi won the Mokama seat in Bihar by-polls on Sunday. Neelam Devi, who secured 79,744 votes defeated BJP's Sonam Devi, who secured 63,003 votes. Meanwhile, Bharatiya Janata Party's Kusum Devi won the Gopalganj seat by defeating RJD's Mohan Prasad Gupta. "My victory was certain...I had already said there's nobody else in my contest," Neelam Devi said.

167.title: Actor-politician Pawan Kalyan sits on roof of speeding car in Andhra; video viral
167.article_body: A video showing actor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan sitting on the roof of a speeding car while going to Ippatam village in Andhra Pradesh is being widely circulated online. The Jana Sena Party President's security personnel and supporters can be seen dangling on the side of the car. Kalyan's convoy was initially stopped by police at the party office.

168.title: Alia shares 1st post after welcoming baby with Ranbir, says 'We're bursting with love'
168.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to announce the birth of her first child with actor Ranbir Kapoor on Sunday. "And in the best news of our lives:- Our baby is here...and what a magical girl she is. We are officially bursting with love - blessed and obsessed Parents!!! love love love Alia and Ranbir," her post read.

169.title: I cried: David Beckham on being given the no. 7 jersey at Man Utd
169.article_body: Manchester United legend David Beckham said he "cried" after being informed that he'll be given the number seven jersey instead of the number 10 jersey by the club's ex-manager Sir Alex Ferguson. "I'd had...one of the best seasons of my career in [the] number 10 shirt...Ferguson said, 'David...We're signing Teddy Sheringham...He's going to have the number 10 shirt'," added Beckham.

170.title: Twitter employee reveals he was fired while on leave to take care of son with cancer
170.article_body: In a LinkedIn post, a Twitter employee revealed that he was fired from the company while he was on leave, taking care of his son battling cancer. Hernan Alvarez Loaiciga wrote, "'New Twitter' let me down when I needed it the most...Looking forward to the next opportunity, and most importantly, to getting medical insurance as soon as possible."

171.title: Govt to set up arbitration centres for speedy disposal of cases: CM Bommai
171.article_body: The Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has confirmed that the government is ready to set up arbitration centres and provide all the facilities for the speedy disposal of court cases. He said that the government will take steps to fill the posts of judges soon. "The role of advocates is very important...there is no delivery of justice without them," said Bommai.

172.title: 50 million doses of Covaxin set to expire early 2023: Report
172.article_body: Nearly 50 million doses of Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, are set to expire early next year as there are no takers owing to poor demand resulting in losses for the company, reports said quoting company sources. Due to lack of product demand, production stoppage of Covaxin was initiated several months ago, earlier this year, the reports added.

173.title: House of Titan introduces IRTH Bags
173.article_body: House of Titan introduced its new women's handbag brand IRTH, stating that every IRTH bag is stylish yet practical, delightful to the last stitch, and thoughtfully designed to make women's everyday organised and joyful. Be it work days, night outs, play dates, or weekend getaways, every IRTH bag is filled with possibilities and is yours to define, it added.

174.title: Earthquake of 4.5 magnitude hits Uttarakhand's Tehri Garhwal
174.article_body: The National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed that an earthquake of magnitude 4.5 on the Richter scale was recorded in Uttarakhand's Tehri Garhwal at 8:33 am this morning. Initial reports said that no damages, casualties or injuries were reported. It occurred at a depth of 5 km, 17 km east-southeast of Uttarkashi with 30.67 latitude and 78.60 longitude.

175.title: Prashant Bhushan joins Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra in Telangana
175.article_body: Activist-lawyer Prashant Bhushan joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for Bharat Jodo Yatra on Sunday in Telangana. "It’s the 60th Day of Bharat Jodo Yatra and it began like every morning…Today we move from Medak to Kamareddy district," Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted. The Bharat Jodo Yatra began on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

176.title: India announce playing XI for their match against Zimbabwe, Pant replaces Dinesh Karthik
176.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against Zimbabwe in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday.
