India have made one change to their playing XI, with Rishabh Pant replacing Dinesh Karthik. India will finish on top of Group 2 points table if they win today.

177.title: Drugs worth ₹20 lakh seized from Nigerian national in Bengaluru
177.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a Nigerian drug peddler for allegedly being involved in drugs supply in Hennur PS limits and recovered drugs worth ₹20 lakh, including 230 grams of MDMA crystals, from the accused. Earlier in October, the Bengaluru Police arrested 11 people for drug peddling, out of which five were foreigners, and seized drugs worth ₹1 crore.

178.title: Cyberabad police raid mujra party at farmhouse, arrest 52 people
178.article_body: As many as 52 people were arrested after the Special Operations Team Shamshabad of Cyberabad police raided a farmhouse where a mujra party was being organised. A police official said that the party was organised by a former rowdy sheeter for his friends over the closing of his rowdy sheet. The arrested persons include four rowdy sheeters.

179.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcome baby girl
179.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcomed a baby girl on Sunday in Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai's Girgaon, Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni confirmed. Alia, who got married to Ranbir on April 14 this year, had announced her pregnancy in an Instagram post in June with pictures and caption, "Our baby...coming soon."

180.title: Pakistan defeat Bangladesh, reach T20 World Cup semi-finals for 2nd time in a row
180.article_body: Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by five wickets in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Sunday. With the victory, Pakistan qualified for the T20 World Cup semi-finals for the second time in a row. Batting first, Bangladesh put up a total of 127/8. Pakistan chased down the target in 18.1 overs.

181.title: Did something very bad: PL footballer Kurt Zouma on cat abuse scandal
181.article_body: Talking about a video that surfaced online in February 2022 where he was seen kicking and slapping his pet cat across his kitchen floor, West Ham United defender Kurt Zouma said, "I...[did] something very bad...I have great remorse." "I learned from it, that's the most important thing, I'd say," added Zouma. Zouma was seen chasing the cat across his room.

182.title: BJP releases manifesto for Himachal polls, promises to implement Uniform Civil Code
182.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda released the party's manifesto for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections on Sunday. If voted to power, the party has promised to implement the Uniform Civil Code in the state. The party has also promised to provide over eight lakh jobs in a phased manner and to open five new medical colleges in the state.

183.title: It's a social impact partnership: BYJU'S Co-founder on Messi deal after announcing layoffs
183.article_body: Days after announcing layoffs, BYJU'S signed up Lionel Messi as a global brand ambassador of its 'Education for All' initiative. Meanwhile, Co-founder Divya Gokulnath said that this wasn't a normal partnership but a "social impact partnership". She said it was "saddening and anguishing" that EFA hadn’t received the same attention in the last 18 months as it did recently.

184.title: BMC engineer asks for ₹50 lakh bribe to halt action against company, held
184.article_body: A BMC executive engineer has been arrested for allegedly demanding ₹50 lakh bribe from a private company in Mumbai. Reports said that he demanded the bribe to halt action against an illegal construction inside the premises of the company. The accused's house was also searched by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) and ₹1.13 crore in cash was found.

185.title: He lost his mind: Di Maria on Messi's speech before Copa America final
185.article_body: Discussing Lionel Messi's speech before the Copa America 2021 final where Argentina defeated Brazil 1-0, Argentine winger Angel Di Maria said, "Messi lost his mind." Argentine defender Lisandro Martinez had earlier stated that one would have felt like eating the entire pitch after listening to Messi's speech before the final. The triumph helped Messi win his first ever international trophy.

186.title: Man thrashes 21-year-old cousin to death for delay in feeding pet dog in Kerala, arrested
186.article_body: A 27-year-old man named Hakeem has been arrested in Kerala's Palakkad for the murder of his 21-year-old cousin Arshad. According to the police, Hakeem thrashed Arshad for delay in feeding his pet dog with the dog's belt and a piece of wood. The beating reportedly caused internal bleeding, leading to his death.

187.title: Need to blend ancient knowledge with modern science, says Jitendra Singh
187.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday emphasised on modernisation of indigenous texts of ancient knowledge as India seeks to assert its scientific prowess in the world. "There's scientific basis to this linking of ancient knowledge...modern science. What India has, others are not aware of it. We're also not aware of what we have...we have been reading their literature," Singh added.

188.title: Traffic restrictions imposed near Hyd's NTR Marg for Formula-E race work
188.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have imposed traffic restrictions in parts of the city today due to civil work being carried out at NTR Marg for the upcoming Formula-E race. As per the traffic advisory, traffic coming from Ambedkar statue towards Necklace Rotary will be diverted and traffic coming from Iqbal Minar towards Telugu Thalli will also be diverted.

189.title: Waiting for new sun to rise: Mahesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir's baby
189.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt said that he's waiting for "a new sun to rise" amid reports that Alia Bhatt is set to give birth to her first child today. "Waiting for a new sun to rise. A fresh sparkling dew drop of life," Mahesh said in an interview. Reportedly, Alia and Ranbir Kapoor arrived at HN Reliance Hospital on Sunday morning.

190.title: Alia Bhatt admitted to hospital, expected to welcome baby soon: Reports
190.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor arrived at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital on Sunday and are expected to welcome their first child soon, according to several reports. Alia's mother Soni Razdan also reportedly arrived at the hospital. Alia had announced her pregnancy in June after sharing a picture on Instagram.

191.title: Don't remember Pak player who impressed after being dropped as captain: Waqar
191.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Kohli said, 'I got dropped as a captain, fine! I'll play as a batter and...be the best fielder'." "In Pakistan, you go home after you're dropped from captaincy. I don't remember any Pakistan player who...got dropped from captaincy and...[made] heads turn as a player," reacted former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis.

192.title: Married man arrested from Thane for cheating women through matrimonial sites
192.article_body: A 42-year-old married man, with two children, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating women after contacting them through matrimonial sites, a Thane police official said. "He'd tell them he is divorcee," the official added. "A probe began after one woman registered complaint…Accused had contacted her between 2018 and 2020 and had cheated her of ₹13.60 lakh," the official stated.

193.title: Pak govt directs PEMRA to lift ban on broadcast of Imran Khan's speeches
193.article_body: After Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) banned TV channels from broadcasting and rebroadcasting former PM Imran Khan's speeches and press conferences on Saturday, the country's government directed the media watchdog to reverse the ban the same day. "Our government believes in the democratic values, freedom of expression," Pakistan's Information and Broadcasting Minister said.

194.title: What just happened, unbelievable pictures: Akram as Netherlands knock SA out of T20 WC
194.article_body: After Netherlands knocked South Africa out of T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram tweeted, "Wait, what just happened...unbelievable pictures from Adelaide." He added, "Congratulations to Netherlands! What a performance." The 13-run victory is Netherlands' first-ever victory against South Africa across formats in international cricket.

195.title: Shakib expresses dissent, refuses to go off after being given out vs Pakistan, video viral
195.article_body: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan expressed dissent to umpires and refused to go off after being given out against Pakistan in T20 World Cup. Shakib was declared LBW out off Shadab Khan after which he used DRS. The replays seemed to show he nicked the ball, however, the third umpire ruled him out. Shakib was then seen talking to umpires.

196.title: Rajinikanth to play cameo role in daughter Aishwarya's 'Lal Salaam'
196.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth will feature in daughter Aishwarya Rajinikanth's directorial project, titled 'Lal Salaam'. The actor will have a special appearance in the film, which will see Vishnu Vishal and Vikranth Santhosh play the lead roles. Lyca Productions will be bankrolling the project, while AR Rahman will be composing the film's music.

197.title: I called up Alia & Katrina first: Priyanka Chopra on 'Jee Le Zaraa'
197.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra said that she called Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt even before Farhan Akhtar came on board for 'Jee Le Zaraa'. She said she wanted to do a Hindi film, but "on the terms of women". "The stars aligned and we decided to do it. Hopefully, we will start to shoot it next year," the actress added.

198.title: Pune man thrashed on suspicion of being police informer, accused arrested
198.article_body: The Yerawada Police arrested a 32-year-old repeat offender in Pune for thrashing a 21-year-old man on Thursday on suspicion that he was a police informer. The victim, Rushikesh Mohite, has suffered injuries on his head. A police officer said, "There was [a] heated argument between the duo and the accused physically assaulted Mohite."

199.title: Musk agrees Twitter staff was previously 'selling verification badges for $15,000'
199.article_body: Elon Musk agreed to a Twitter user who claimed that the company’s employees sold verification "for upwards of $15,000". The user alleged that the staff would refuse to verify through the standard application and then "privately offer to verify users for $$ behind the scenes". In another tweet, Musk also said, "Far too many legacy "verified" checkmarks were handed out".

200.title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 15 Indian fishermen for alleged poaching
200.article_body: The Sri Lanka Navy has arrested at least 15 Indian fishermen off Talaimannar in Mannar Island for alleged poaching in the country's territorial waters, an official statement said on Sunday. It added that the arrested fishermen will be handed over to the fisheries inspector. This comes after Sri Lanka and India held an international maritime boundary line meeting on Friday.

201.title: Elon Musk parody account posts Hindi memes, 'Lollipop Lagelu' lyrics; suspended
201.article_body: An Elon Musk parody Twitter account that posted several Hindi memes, tweets and Bhojpuri song 'Lollipop Lagelu' lyrics has been suspended. The account had led to confusion among users, with a Twitter user tweeting, "I am confused which one is original." Another user tweeted, "What's going on Twitter? There are two [Elon Musk] on Twitter with...similar profile and similar bio."

202.title: India reports 1,132 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,839
202.article_body: India reported 1,132 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 1,082 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India went down to 14,839 from the earlier 15,200. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,500, according to the ministry.

203.title: 2 cheetahs in MP's Kuno shifted to bigger enclosure, PM says 'great news'
203.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his happiness over the release of two cheetahs in Kuno National Park's bigger enclosure after completing their mandatory quarantine and said that the cheetahs are healthy and adjusting well. PM Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "Great news...cheetahs have been released...for further adaptation to the Kuno habitat. Others will be released soon."

204.title: I am lost for words: Netherlands captain after knocking SA out of T20 WC
204.article_body: Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said it's going to take "a bit of time" to take in their win against South Africa in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "I am lost for words...Another great experience, another big upset from the Netherlands," he stated. Notably, it is Netherlands' first win against South Africa across any format.

205.title: Yo Kanye let's talk, man to man: Singer Aaron Carter in last tweet before death
205.article_body: In his last tweets before his death, singer Aaron Carter had tweeted about Kanye West amid controversy over the latter's anti-semitic remarks. "Yo Kanye let's talk...man to man," Carter had written in his last tweet. The 34-year-old singer was found dead in a bathtub at his home in US' California on Saturday.

206.title: Pakistan-Bangladesh match becomes virtual quarter-final as SA knocked out of T20 WC
206.article_body: The Pakistan-Bangladesh Super 12 stage Group 2 match has become a virtual T20 World Cup 2022 quarter-final after South Africa got eliminated from the semi-finals race after losing to Netherlands. The winner of the Pakistan-Bangladesh match will get to six points on the points table and advance to the semi-finals. India have already qualified for the semi-finals from the group.

207.title: 22-year-old student arrested for selling drug-laced chocolates in Hyd
207.article_body: The Narcotics Enforcement Wing, along with Musheerabad Police, arrested a 22-year-old student, Rishi Sanjay Mehata, from Hyderabad’s Narsingi for allegedly selling cannabis-infused chocolates in the city. Police seized 48 bars of drug-laced chocolates and 40 grams of hash oil. "About 50% of consumers the accused was catering to are girls aged between 18 and 24 years," police said.

208.title: Deepika has calming effect, John is well-mannered person: SRK
208.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan, during an #AskSRK session on Twitter, opened up about his experience of sharing screen space with Deepika Padukone and John Abraham in his upcoming film 'Pathaan'. While he said Deepika has a "calming effect" on sets, Shah Rukh called John "one of the most mild and well-mannered person". 'Pathaan' marks Shah Rukh's first collaboration with John.

209.title: Railways asked to pay ₹50,000 to Mumbai man for non-functioning of AC in Duronto Express
209.article_body: A consumer commission in Mumbai has ordered the Railways to pay ₹50,000 to a commuter for non-functioning of AC in Duronto Express while the daytime temperature was over 40-degree Celsius. Shivshankar Ramshringar Shukla booked a first-class AC ticket to return to Mumbai from Prayagraj in 2017. Railways was asked to pay ₹35,000 for mental agony and ₹15,000 towards litigation costs.

210.title: India's spin bowling a huge concern, they need a wrist spinner: Gambhir
210.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has termed India's spin bowling as a "huge concern". "If you don't pick up wickets in the middle overs, and if you are playing against England in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, it can come back to hurt you," added Gambhir. "If India are missing anything, it is a wrist spinner," he stated.

211.title: Several rooftop restaurants demolished in Pune's Baner, Balewadi
211.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) demolished several rooftop restaurants in the city's Baner and Balewadi area as a part of its anti-encroachment drive. A total area of over 6,400 square feet has been demolished, the civic officials said. The action was taken against restaurants named Hotel Vintage, 7 Rooftop Hotel, Hotel Basuri, Hotel Soya Affairs and Hotel Rustle Nest.

212.title: 2 youths lathered in soap take bath while riding bike in Kerala, booked
212.article_body: Two youths have been booked for allegedly taking a bath while riding a bike in Kerala. Reports said that the youths were coming back from a sports event and decided to take a bath on the bike for fun as it was raining. They were reportedly lathered in soap. They were fined ₹5,000.

213.title: 22-year-old woman extorts ₹10 lakh from Delhi businessman; arrested
213.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 22-year-old woman for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from a businessman and then asking him to register his property in her name or give her another crore. According to police, the woman threatened the businessman to expose their relationship to his family, who were not aware of this. She even threatened to file a false rape case.

214.title: At least 10 people shot outside a bar in US: Reports
214.article_body: At least 10 people have been shot outside a bar in US' Philadelphia, according to reports. Gunshot victims were reportedly rushed to a number of hospitals based on the severity of their injuries. A video has surfaced online, showing heavy police presence in the region after the reported shooting.

215.title: 10 years ago, people used to make fun of South films: Yash
215.article_body: Actor Yash said that a decade ago, when dubbed films became popular in North India, people used to make fun of South films. He said South films were sold at "a bare minimum price", used to have poor quality dubbing, and were presented in a bad manner. He credited SS Rajamouli for changing people's perception towards South films with 'Baahubali'.

216.title: Cricket of an extremely low standard: Irfan on Warner's dismissal vs Afg
216.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has termed David Warner's dismissal in Australia's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Afghanistan as "cricket of an extremely low standard". "He would have heard a few choice words if I was there in their camp. You are trying to play a switch hit against a pacer when you are still searching for...form," added Irfan.

217.title: Edtech startup Practically cuts jobs, holds salaries citing funds crunch: Report
217.article_body: Edtech startup Practically has reportedly fired permanent staffers across departments, while also failing to pay salaries to many of its contractual and permanent employees over the last three to four months citing a liquidity crunch and pending fundraising. While employees began receiving termination emails in early October, the exact number of laid-off employees is not yet known.

218.title: Police seize illegally stored Calcium Carbide worth ₹40 lakh in Hyd
218.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force officials along with the Musheerabad Police in Hyderabad arrested two persons and seized about 500 barrels of Calcium Carbide from their possession. The seized chemicals, worth ₹40 lakh, were stored illegally in a residential area in Bakaram. When Calcium Carbide is exposed to water or moisture, it forms highly flammable and explosive Acetylene gas, police said.

219.title: Passenger traffic increases at B'luru airport as 16.3 mn travelled this year
219.article_body: The air passenger traffic at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) increased as around 16.30 million passengers visited the airport till October this financial year, the airport said. Last year, 6.61 million passengers visited the airport during the same period. Compared to 2019, domestic passenger traffic increased by over 102% and international travel recorded 85% growth this year.

220.title: Couple on ventilator after Thane fire incident, their 7-yr-old son safe
220.article_body: Two residents of the 15-storey building in Thane, where a fire broke out on Saturday, have been reported to be on ventilator. They have been identified as 37-year-old Amol Kulkarni and his 33-year-old wife Vrushali Kulkarni. Reports said that their seven-year-old son is safe as he was not in the house when the fire broke out.

221.title: Again we faltered when it mattered: SA's Bavuma after defeat vs Netherlands
221.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after getting knocked out of the ongoing T20 World Cup following their defeat against Netherlands, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "[It's a] hard one to swallow for the guys." He added, "We knew it was a must-win game and again we faltered when it mattered." Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs.

222.title: 2 workers die after falling into sewage chamber of an MNC in Pune
222.article_body: Two workers died of suffocation while cleaning the sewage chamber of a multinational company in Pune. "[They] were working on [the] suction pipe after opening the cover of [the] chamber when one of them fell inside the tank. The other person also fell inside the chamber while rescuing the first one," said a police officer.

223.title: Woman run over by her own car 3 times after stopping on a slope in Switzerland
223.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was hospitalised after she was run over by her own car in Switzerland's St Gallen. Police said she was getting something out of the boot when her car, which was on a slight slope, struck her after rolling backwards. It ran over her two more times as it rebounded after hitting another vehicle and then a pavement.

224.title: Twitter to soon add ability to attach long-form text to tweets: Elon Musk
224.article_body: Elon Musk has tweeted that Twitter will soon add the ability to attach long-form text to tweets, "ending the absurdity of notepad screenshots." Replying to a Twitter user who asked if the feature would be like Twitter Notes, Musk said, "Something like that." Notably, in some countries, Twitter has launched the $8 monthly charge for its blue tick subscription service.

225.title: Counting of votes in by-polls to 7 Assembly seats in 6 states underway
225.article_body: Counting of votes is underway for by-polls to seven vacant Assembly seats across six states. Polling for the Assembly constituencies, which include Gopalganj and Mokama in Bihar, Adampur in Haryana, Andheri (East) in Maharashtra, Munugode in Telangana, Gola Gokrannath in Uttar Pradesh and Dhamnagar in Odisha, was held on November 3. Munugode had witnessed a voter turnout of over 93%.

226.title: Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro barricades removal to start this month: MMRCL
226.article_body: The barricades put up on Mumbai roads since October 2016 for Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro will be removed starting this month, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (MMRCL) MD Ashwini Bhide said. "Our attempt is to reinstate maximum roads before the 2023 monsoon. Only some sections would remain, where barricade withdrawal will happen by October, these would be towards South Mumbai," Bhide added.

227.title: Kohli's life is different from mine, he had MS Dhoni: Ahmad Shahzad
227.article_body: Talking about being compared to Virat Kohli in the past, Pakistan batter Ahmad Shahzad said, "[We can't be compared] because [our lives are]...different...He had MS Dhoni." "You can either have support from everyone or...[face a scenario where] everyone is trying to keep you out," added Shahzad. "Our senior players...can't digest seeing someone succeed," he had earlier stated.

228.title: Pankaj Tripathi's 'Criminal Justice' to be renewed for 4th season
228.article_body: Applause Entertainment's CEO Sameer Nair has confirmed the fourth season of 'Criminal Justice', which is headlined by Pankaj Tripathi. "Madhav Mishra (Pankaj's character) has become a character in his own right. So yes, now we are hard at work for putting together season 4," the producer confirmed. He added that the team has already started work on the show's script.

229.title: Cong means guarantee of corruption, selfish politics: PM in Himachal
229.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh polls, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said Congress means the guarantee of "corruption and selfish politics". "During Congress' rule, there were various groups that had a vested interest in unstable governments," PM Modi said while addressing a rally in Solan. "BJP's work and resolve are strong while in Congress there's indecisiveness, uncertainty and anarchy," he added.

230.title: If you depend on Ashwin for batting, then what about your top 7: Gavaskar
230.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has criticised Team India management, questioning Ravichandran Ashwin's selection over Yuzvendra Chahal in India's playing XI in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "If you are going to depend on [Ashwin at] number eight [for batting], what does it tell you about your top 7 then?" asked Gavaskar. "India's batting has not quite...really clicked," he added.

231.title: TN to start NEET coaching for Class 11 & 12 from 3rd week of Nov
231.article_body: Tamil Nadu School Education Department has announced that it will start coaching classes for Class 11 and 12 for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) from the third week of November. Over 400 centres have been identified for providing the classes. The classes will be conducted in both Tamil and English and students can opt for either language.

232.title: You can't say Dinesh Karthik has flopped after 3 chances: Harbhajan
232.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said Dinesh Karthik should be backed as a finisher, adding that Karthik cannot be termed as a flop on the basis of "three chances". "There are other players who've failed...We don't talk about them...[as their stature is high]," stated Harbhajan. Karthik has scored 14 runs in four matches played so far by India in T20 World Cup 2022.

233.title: India qualify for semi-finals as Netherlands knock South Africa out of T20 World Cup 2022
233.article_body: India have qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs in a Super 12 stage match. Batting first, Netherlands put up a total of 158/4, with Colin Ackermann top-scoring with 41*(26). South Africa were restricted to 145/8. The winner of Pakistan-Bangladesh match will qualify for semi-finals, while South Africa have been knocked out.

234.title: Fraudster tells Maha man to invest in US company, cheats him of ₹59.8 lakh
234.article_body: A retired man in Navi Mumbai lost ₹59.8 lakh after a fraudster, who he met online, lured him into investing in a US-based company. The fraudster reportedly promised the victim seven times return on investment. The victim deposited the money in instalments into a bank account given to him. He later realised that he had been cheated of this money.

235.title: Twitter Blue roll out can be expected in less than a month in India: Elon Musk
235.article_body: Elon Musk has said Twitter Blue roll out can be expected within a month in India. A Twitter user asked, "When can we expect to have Twitter Blue roll out in India?" to which Musk replied, "Hopefully, less than a month." Twitter Blue with verification is currently available on iOS in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK.

236.title: Twitter begins rolling out $8 blue tick verification plan for iOS users in some countries
236.article_body: Twitter on Sunday began rolling out the $7.99 monthly charge for verified accounts, as announced by Elon Musk. Launched for Apple iOS users, the upgraded Twitter Blue includes benefits like "half the ads", the ability to post longer videos and priority ranking for quality content. The update is currently available in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK.

237.title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor' today with 363 AQI; Noida's AQI at 374
237.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Sunday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 363. The AQI in Noida also stood in the 'very poor' category at 374, while in Gurugram it stood at 384. The AQI in Delhi around the same time on Saturday was recorded at 431.

238.title: L&T Metro Rail, TSRTC sign agreement to ease travel in Hyderabad
238.article_body: The L&T Metro Rail (Hyderabad) Limited and Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) on Saturday signed a memorandum of understanding so as to ensure easier and more comfortable transportation facilities in Hyderabad. The agreement will also offer first and last-mile connectivity service in the city. TSRTC Managing Director VC Sajjanar said that the agreement is "historic".

239.title: Sri Lanka's Gunathilaka allegedly rapes 29-yr-old woman in Sydney amid T20 WC, arrested
239.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Danushka Gunathilaka has been arrested after being charged by police for allegedly raping a 29-year-old woman in Sydney amid the T20 World Cup 2022. As per police, he had met the victim after communicating with her via an online dating application. Gunathilaka was ruled out of T20 World Cup during the first round due to injury.

240.title: 34-year-old singer Aaron Carter found dead in bathtub at his home in US
240.article_body: Singer Aaron Carter, the younger brother of Backstreet Boys singer Nick Carter, was found dead in bathtub at his home in California on Saturday. Aaron gained recognition after opening for Backstreet Boys on their 1997 tour when he was just 10. The 34-year-old went public about being diagnosed with multiple personality disorder, schizophrenia, acute anxiety and manic depression in 2019.

241.title: Around 25 shops gutted in fire in Mumbai's Fashion Street, none injured
241.article_body: As many as 25 shops of clothes, footwear and accessories were completely gutted in fire in Mumbai's Fashion Street, located near Churchgate, after one of the shops caught fire on Saturday. However, no injuries were reported in the incident. As per locals, the blaze started due to a short circuit in one of the shops and quickly spread to others.

242.title: Twitter begins rolling out $8 blue tick verification service for iOS in some countries
242.article_body: Twitter on Saturday began rolling out $8 verification service which Elon Musk had announced. Twitter Blue with verification is currently available on iOS in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK. In an update on iPhones, Twitter said, "Blue checkmark: Power to people. Your account will get a blue checkmark, just like...celebrities, companies, and politicians you already follow."

243.title: 2,000 Mumbai stray dogs to get reflective collars to avoid night accidents
243.article_body: Online forum Planet for Plants and Animals (PPA), along with the students of Mithibai College, will be putting reflective collars on approximately 2,000 stray dogs to protect them from accidents at night. The drive would be launched at the Marine Drive today. It will be completed in a phased manner over a period of six weeks.

244.title: Free speech isn't a free pass, ensure human rights at Twitter: UN to Musk
244.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, in an open letter to Elon Musk, stressed certain human rights principles and urged him to ensure human rights at Twitter. "Free speech is not a free pass," he wrote. He added that reports of Twitter firing its entire human rights team were not "an encouraging start".

245.title: Sukesh Chandrashekhar has become BJP's star campaigner: AAP leader
245.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat Assembly and Delhi MCD polls, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj on Saturday said, "Big leaders of BJP have to use maha (biggest) thug like Sukesh Chandrashekhar...He has become a star campaigner of BJP." "The way BJP has panicked due to the...polls, it is visible in their nervousness," Bharadwaj added. Chandrashekhar is the main accused in an extortion case.

246.title: Players from Delhi belt have strength, boldness to perform: Dhawan on Kohli
246.article_body: Speaking about his teammate Virat Kohli, India's opening batter Shikhar Dhawan said that players from the Delhi belt have the strength and boldness to perform on the cricket field. Asked about Kohli's knock against Pakistan in the ongoing T20 World, Dhawan said that it was more important to follow the process instead of paying heed to the critics.

247.title: Asian Hockey Federation CEO Tayyab Ikram elected as new FIH Prez
247.article_body: Asian Hockey Federation CEO Mohammad Tayyab Ikram was elected as the new president of the International Hockey Federation (FIH) on Saturday. Ikram will succeed India's Narinder Batra as FIH's full-time chief. Ikram defeated Marc Coudron of Belgium 79-47 in the 48th FIH Congress. Notably, Ikram is a citizen of Macau but was born in Pakistan.

248.title: Senate Prez among 2 Haitian politicians sanctioned by US, Canada
248.article_body: The US and Canada on Friday imposed sanctions on two Haitian politicians, including the president of Haiti's Senate, as Washington accused them of indulging in drug trafficking and collaborating with gang networks. A US Treasury Department official said Youri Latortue and Haitian Senate President Joseph Lambert had "abused their official positions" to undermine the rule of law in Haiti.

249.title: Bihar will be among top 5 states in 2 yrs if given special status: Dy CM
249.article_body: Bihar will be counted among the top five states of India in just two years if it's granted special status by the Centre, Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said on Saturday. He claimed Bihar has been granted only ₹7.35 crore for the development of urban local bodies. He pointed out that Jharkhand, which is smaller than Bihar, is getting ₹12 crore.

250.title: 9 coaches of Nankana Sahib-bound train derail in Pakistan
250.article_body: A special train for Pakistani Sikh pilgrims to attend Guru Nanak's birth anniversary celebrations at Nankana Sahib in Punjab province derailed on Saturday. A Pakistan Railways spokesperson said nobody was injured in the incident. The official said nine bogies of the train, which was going from Karachi to Nankana Sahib, had derailed.

251.title: How often do you get chance to put Kohli in your pocket: Zimbabwe captain on India clash
251.article_body: Ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match against India on Saturday, Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said there's a great opportunity for his bowlers to bowl against some of the best batters in the world. "How often do you get the opportunity to put Virat Kohli in your pocket? I'm pretty sure...our pacers will be raring to go," he added.

252.title: Kohli is a champion player in all three formats: Ponting
252.article_body: Ex-Australian skipper Ricky Ponting said that Indian batter Virat Kohli is a "champion player of the game in all three formats for a long period of time". "India are now reaping the rewards of keeping him (Kohli) there...He's always been a really hard worker...I'm sure he'll produce something big in one of the finals as well," Ponting added.

253.title: Climate activists glue themselves to Goya paintings in Spain
253.article_body: Two climate activists on Saturday glued themselves to the frames of two paintings by prominent 18th-century Spanish painter Francisco Goya at the Prado Museum in Spain's Madrid, police said. Neither painting was damaged in the protest. The protesters drew "+1.5°C" on the wall between the two paintings, referring to the global temperature rise cap set by the 2015 Paris Agreement.

254.title: Chinese central bank's Dy Governor being probed for violations
254.article_body: A Deputy Governor in China's central bank is being investigated for alleged "serious violations of discipline and law", the ruling Communist Party's corruption agency said on Saturday. However, the details of the allegations against Fan Yifei have not been released. Fan joined the People's Bank of China in 2015 after a career in finance.

255.title: Focus on football, don't drag it into ideological battles: FIFA
255.article_body: Football governing body FIFA has urged the 32 teams preparing for the Qatar World Cup to focus on the game and avoid raising political issues. FIFA told federations to "not allow football to be dragged into every ideological or political battle that exists". Qatar as host sparked scrutiny on its treatment of low-paid migrant workers and laws criminalising same-sex relationships.

256.title: 'Full court commission' must probe Imran Khan’s allegations: Pak PM
256.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Saturday that the Chief Justice of Pakistan must constitute a "full court commission" to investigate the allegations levelled by former PM Imran Khan. Khan, who was shot at in Wazirabad on November 3, has accused Prime Minister Sharif, Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah and Major General Faisal Naseer of orchestrating the assassination attempt.

257.title: 'F*** off' is a sexually coloured remark: Delhi court in sexual harassment case
257.article_body: Delhi's Tis Hazari court upheld a sexual harassment case against a man for saying "f*** off" to a woman and threatening her in 2019. Calling "f*** off" a "sexually coloured remark", the court said, "In Indian society...this word is not used to ask anyone to leave or go away." The man allegedly also called the woman a 'bazaru aurat'.

258.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan' makers donate ₹1 cr to Kalki Krishnamurthy Memorial Trust
258.article_body: Mani Ratnam's Madras Talkies and Lyca Productions, the makers of 'Ponniyin Selvan', have donated ₹1 crore to the Kalki Krishnamurthy Memorial Trust. A cheque was presented to the trust's Managing Trustee Seetha Ravi in the presence of Kalki Rajendran, son of 'Ponniyin Selvan' author Kalki Krishnamurthy. The trust helps underprivileged students with their education by giving them scholarships.

259.title: T20 more about older person's game: Ricky Ponting
259.article_body: Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting commented on the dynamics of cricket's T20 format. "I've also learned about the T20 game over the years that I've been involved, is it's more of an older man's game, or older person's game, than a young man's game," Ponting said. Notably, the 47-year-old former cricketer has won two ODI World Cups as a skipper.

260.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from Ukrainian power grid
260.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, which is under Russian control, has been disconnected from Ukraine's power grid. The Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant is the largest in Europe. It has six power units and a capacity of 6,000 MW. Ukraine's nuclear power plant operator Energoatom's head said, Zaporizhzhia generated almost half of all the electricity produced by all nuclear plants in Ukraine.

261.title: I-League winner from this season onwards to be promoted to ISL: AIFF
261.article_body: The AIFF has announced that the winner of the I-League will play in the ISL next season, without paying any fee. The promotion of I-League winners of the 2022-23 season, as well as 2023-24, to the ISL, will be subject to fulfilling the club licensing criteria. "The decision is as per the roadmap which was agreed earlier," said AIFF.

262.title: Kyrgios settles case with Wimbledon fan he accused of being drunk
262.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios apologised to the fan he accused of being "drunk out of her mind" during his loss in this year's Wimbledon final. Kyrgios also donated £20,000 (₹18.65 lakh) to a charity of her choice after she filed a case against him. The fan stated that Kyrgios defamed her by making "a reckless and entirely baseless allegation".

263.title: India resumes sugar exports, allows 6 mn tonnes on quota basis till May 31
263.article_body: The government on Saturday allowed the export of six million tonnes of sugar on quota basis till May 31. The ministry has allocated a uniform export quota of 18.23% of the three years average production in operational sugar seasons. The government had restricted sugar exports towards the end of the 2021-22 season (October-September) to ensure sufficient stocks for domestic consumption.

264.title: England defender Ben Chilwell to miss Qatar WC due to hamstring injury
264.article_body: England defender Ben Chilwell will miss FIFA World Cup in Qatar after scans showed he had suffered significant damage to his hamstring. "Following my ACL injury, I worked so hard to make sure I was ready for the World Cup...Unfortunately, this won't be possible," said Chilwell. The Chelsea player was injured during the club's Champions League match against Dinamo Zagreb.

265.title: Prez of Ram Janmabhoomi trust hospitalised with urinary infection
265.article_body: Mahant Nritya Gopal Das, the President of Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, has been admitted to Medanta hospital in Uttar Pradesh following a urinary infection and general weakness. "He was brought from Ayodhya and admitted to the hospital on Friday," the hospital's Medical Director Rakesh Kapoor said. "On Saturday, his condition was stable and satisfactory," the doctor added.

266.title: Aakash praises Curran while joking about commentator's curse, he gets out next ball
266.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra praised England's Sam Curran while joking about commentator's curse with Harbhajan Singh, following which Curran got out in T20 World Cup match against Sri Lanka. Prior to the ball, Harbhajan asked Aakash, "Sometimes...batters we praise...they get out...How does this happen?" Aakash joked, "See...how good Curran is playing." Curran was dismissed on next ball for 6(11).

267.title: Indian Navy chief arrives in Japan ahead of Malabar Exercise
267.article_body: Indian Navy chief Admiral R Hari Kumar reached Japan on Saturday ahead of the beginning of this year's Malabar Exercise. Admiral Kumar and his Australian, Japanese and US counterparts exchanged views on further enhancing cooperation under the maritime exercise's framework, officials said. Admiral Kumar will be in Japan from November 5-9, during which he will attend the inauguration of Malabar-22.

268.title: Illegal house of 2 habitual criminals bulldozed in Ujjain
268.article_body: A two-storey illegal house of two habitual criminals in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain was bulldozed by the administration on Saturday. The accused, Roshan Pasi and Sonu Pasi, recently attacked city security committee convenor Ashok Verma. When police started demolishing the house, a saint claimed the house in the name of an ashram and opposed the proceedings. However, police bulldozed the building.

269.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for India's T20 WC Super 12 group?
269.article_body: India and South Africa will qualify for semi-finals if they defeat Zimbabwe and Netherlands, respectively in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 2 matches. In case Netherlands defeat South Africa, the winner of Bangladesh-Pakistan match will advance along with India. Pakistan and South Africa can qualify if they win their respective matches and India lose to Zimbabwe.

270.title: Earth's closest-ever black hole found, is 10 times the size of the Sun
270.article_body: Astronomers working at the International Gemini Observatory in the US have found a black hole, named Gaia BH1, that lies closest to the Earth. It is the first-ever detected dormant stellar-mass black hole of the Milky Way galaxy, scientists said, adding that its size is 10 times that of the Sun in our solar system. It's located 1600 light-years away.

271.title: Used to sell water cans, work in hotels: Kantara's Rishab on struggling days
271.article_body: 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab Shetty in a recent interview recalled how he used to do odd jobs like selling water cans and working in hotels to make ends meet during his days of struggle. "Whatever jobs I got, I did. [In] 2004, I started and in 2014...I got my first direction so in 10 years I had to survive," he added.

272.title: WHO Leprosy Goodwill Ambassador visits health centre in Ranchi
272.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Goodwill Ambassador for Leprosy Elimination Yohei Sasakawa on Saturday reviewed works undertaken in Jharkhand to eradicate leprosy, an official said. Yohei visited a primary health centre in Pithoria area of Ranchi and interacted with the workers there. "Leprosy is neither a curse of God nor a spreading disease. It can be cured completely," Yohei said.

273.title: Police seize drugs worth ₹5 cr in Assam's Guwahati, 2 arrested
273.article_body: Police on Saturday seized large quantities of drugs worth ₹5 crore from a vehicle and arrested two drug peddlers in connection with the case. The accused were identified as Rajib Miyan and Rekib Ahmed, hailing from Mankachar. "The vehicle was going from Guwahati to Mankachar...We've recovered 20,000 Yaba tablets in possession of two persons in the vehicle," police said.

274.title: Case against ex-PFI leader's family for smuggling SIM card into jail
274.article_body: Kerala Police has registered a case against the family of PFI's former Idukki District President TS Sainudeen for allegedly attempting to smuggle a SIM card hidden in the Quran into jail. The case against his wife, son Mohammed Yasin and Sainudeen's brother was registered under the Prison Act, said the police. The incident reportedly took place on November 1.

275.title: Nike suspends partnership with NBA star Kyrie over antisemitic tweet
275.article_body: Nike has suspended its relationship with NBA player Kyrie Irving after he tweeted a link to an antisemitic film last week. The shoemaker has cancelled its next Irving-branded shoe, the Kyrie 8. The shoe deal, reportedly worth $11 million a year, began in 2014. Irving apologised on Thursday after being suspended by Brooklyn Nets for at least five games.

276.title: It's just a phase: Rakul on being asked if 'Bollywood is dead'
276.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, when asked if she believes Bollywood is 'dead', said, "It's just a phase." She added people love to write about things that aren't working. Rakul further said that the audience's taste has changed after the pandemic and they want "larger-than-life cinema". Rakul was seen in 'Thank God', 'Dr. G', 'Cuttputli' and 'Runway 34' this year.

277.title: Power Grid Corporation's Q2 net profit rises over 8% YoY to ₹3,650 cr
277.article_body: Power Grid Corporation of India posted an 8.1% year-over-year growth in net profit to ₹3,650.16 crore during the July-September quarter against ₹3,376.38 crore from year-ago period. Its revenue rose 8.6% year-over-year to ₹11,150.57 crore. The board of directors approved payment of an interim dividend of ₹5/equity share of ₹10 each (at 50% of the paid-up equity share capital) for FY23.

278.title: 206 head constables and 419 constables promoted in J&K
278.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police has promoted 206 head constables and 419 constables, said a police spokesperson on Saturday. "On the recommendations of the Departmental Promotion Committee, ADGP (Additional Director General of Police) Kashmir, Vijay Kumar has approved the promotions," the spokesman said. The formal promotion orders of 156 head constables are pending a pre-promotion course, he added.

279.title: 5 lakh diyas lit in Varanasi's Gadauli Dham to mark 'Tulsi Vivah'
279.article_body: Around 5 lakh earthen lamps (diyas) were lit in Varanasi's Gadauli Dham on Saturday to mark the festival of 'Tulsi Vivah'. A video showing several people lighting diyas and clicking selfies at the site has surfaced online. The ceremonial wedding of goddess Tulsi signifies the end of the monsoon season and the beginning of the wedding season in Hinduism.

280.title: Newly discovered star system may be oldest in our galaxy: Scientists
280.article_body: Scientists have discovered a new star system that they believe could be the oldest in our galaxy. It consists of two white dwarf stars and the remains of rocky planets that are over 10 billion years old. As per researchers, the light of the two stars, located about 90 light-years from Earth, is changing colour due to rocky planets' remains.

281.title: Can't restrict a woman's right to reproductive choice: Kerala HC
281.article_body: No restriction can be placed on a woman's right to exercise her reproductive choice, the Kerala High Court (HC) said, as it allowed a 23-year-old MBA student to terminate her 26-week pregnancy. The observation was made by Justice VG Arun in an order on November 2. The woman was experiencing stress and the pregnancy may risk her life, he said.

282.title: Bridgerton 2's Charithra visits Thanjavur temple, eats on banana leaf; shares pics
282.article_body: Charithra Chandran, the British actress who starred in 'Bridgerton season 2', took to Instagram to share pictures from her visit to her native place in Tamil Nadu. She visited Airavatesvara Temple located in Kumbakonam, Thanjavur. A picture shared by Charithra showed food being served on a banana leaf in a restaurant. Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "Love this."

283.title: Punjab could see return to the dark era of 1980s: Ex-CM Amarinder
283.article_body: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said "the way things are unfolding in the state", it could see the return of the dark era of the 1980s. He condemned the "complete failure" of the AAP government in taking action even 24 hours after Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader Sudhir Suri's murder. He added that gangsters were "having a free run" in the state.

284.title: Cong promises free power, ₹1,500 per month for women in Himachal poll manifesto
284.article_body: The Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections in the presence of Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel. If elected to power, the party has promised ₹1,500 per month to women, 300 units of free electricity and the purchase of cow dung at ₹2 per kg. Congress has also promised to implement the old pension scheme.

285.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards test satellite carrier: State media
285.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards test-launched a solid-fueled satellite carrier called the Ghaem-100 on Saturday, Iranian state media reported. The rocket would be able to put a satellite weighing 80 kg into orbit some 500 kilometres from Earth, state media said. The West has long been suspicious of Iran's space program as the same technology can be used to develop long-range missiles.

286.title: Rain kills 3 people in Tamil Nadu, season toll rises to 26
286.article_body: Three more people have died in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of deaths due to rains in the state this season to 26, said officials on Saturday. CM MK Stalin has ordered a solatium of ₹4 lakh for the families of each deceased person. Tamil Nadu received 10.04 mm of rain in the last 24 hours.

287.title: Congress poll promises won’t be taken seriously in Himachal: Thakur
287.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress over its poll promises made in Himachal Pradesh, claiming no one will take them seriously as the party itself has "no guarantee". Thakur said various promises made by Congress in the past have remained unfulfilled. He added that farmers in Punjab voted out Congress for failing to fulfil its loan waiver promise.

288.title: Unexploded mortar shell defused near LoC in J&K's Poonch district
288.article_body: A live mortar shell was defused at a village in the forward area along the LoC in J&K's Poonch district on Saturday, officials informed. A bomb disposal squad was rushed to the village when authorities received information about the unexploded ordnance, as per officials. It apparently landed in the village during cross-border shelling by Pakistan some years ago, officials said.

289.title: Pray for return of Kailash Mansarovar & PoK to India: RSS leader
289.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar asked Indians to offer special prayers every morning for the return of Kailash Mansarovar and PoK from the "illegal occupation" of China and Pakistan. "The common man in India is of the opinion that India is incomplete without Karachi, Nankana Sahib and Sharada Peeth," he added. He also called for having faith in PM Modi's policies.

290.title: Fan from Goa would send me vials of blood, obscene pics via courier: Raveena Tandon
290.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon, while recalling a fan stalking incident, said that a fan from Goa was convinced that he was married to her. "He'd send me vials of blood through courier, he'd send letters written in blood and obscene photographs," she added. She further said, "It was really crazy and scary."

291.title: 600 disabled persons in Fiji to get artificial limbs via Jaipur Foot
291.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs of India, as part of its 'India for Humanity' programme, will provide artificial limbs to 600 disabled people through NGO Jaipur Foot in Fiji. Fijian PM Frank Bainimarama inaugurated the Jaipur Foot Artificial Limb Fitment Camp at a hospital in Suva. "A professionally fitted prosthetic can boost feelings of self-esteem, self-worth and dignity," Bainimarama said.

292.title: Opposition 'unnecessarily' spreading the fear of dengue: UP Dy CM
292.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Saturday accused the opposition of "unnecessarily" spreading the fear of dengue among the people and said the situation was under control. "Ministers are moving in districts and monitoring the arrangements for prevention of dengue," Pathak said. His comment comes after Samajwadi Party claimed the state government was misleading people on dengue cases.

293.title: Planning state's first lion safari in north Bengal: Forest Minister
293.article_body: According to West Bengal Forest Minister Jyotipriya Mallick, the forest department is planning to come up with the state's first lion safari in north Bengal. "We already have a tiger safari in north Bengal," Mallick said. "We're going to approach the Central Zoo Authority for the permission by the end of this month," an official of state zoo authority said.

294.title: Congress will fight against attempts to divide WB: Adhir Chowdhury
294.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Saturday said that his party will never allow the division of West Bengal. "Elections are coming, so BJP is raking up such issues. Congress will always fight against any attempt to divide West Bengal," Chowdhury said. "If...people of northern West Bengal feel neglected, it's the responsibility of...state government to address it," he added.

295.title: Who takes Cong seriously? It'll win less than 5 seats in Guj: Kejriwal
295.article_body: While speaking at a media conclave on Saturday, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal questioned, "Who takes the Congress seriously?" Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader also predicted that the Congress will win less than five seats in the state. Kejriwal further claimed that his party will get 30% vote share in the elections.

296.title: I realise many are angry with me, I apologise: Twitter Co-founder as Musk orders layoffs
296.article_body: As Twitter laid off 50% of its employees company-wide after Elon Musk acquired it, its Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said, "I realize many are angry with me." He added, "I own the responsibility for why everyone is in this situation: I grew the company size too quickly. I apologise for that." He called Twitter employees "strong and resilient".

297.title: Wood is very intelligent bowler, offers a lot more than just pace: Farokh
297.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Farokh Engineer said that English pacer Mark Wood is a very intelligent bowler. "Wood won't change his approach; he will keep on bowling quicker and as quick as he can. He will use the bouncer effectively," Engineer said. He added, "The thing is that all English players play professional cricket, so they are more professional than Sri Lankans."

298.title: 2 DRG jawans killed in a road accident in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
298.article_body: Two jawans of the District Reserve Group (DRG) died on Saturday after their two-wheeler collided head-on with a trailer in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district. "The two DRG jawans met with a road accident along Sukma-Kerlapal National Highway and succumbed to injuries," Bastar IG Sundarraj P said. The deceased were identified as Padam Muya and Mausam Subba.

299.title: 50 students fall sick after eating poha at govt school in Telangana
299.article_body: Over 50 students at a government school fell ill due to food poisoning and were admitted to a hospital in Telangana's Sangareddy, Narayankhed Revenue Divisional Officer Ambadas Rajeshwar said. According to him, the students had consumed poha as breakfast in the morning, following which a few of them found worms in the food. "The students are...out of danger," Rajeshwar added.

300.title: Berkshire Hathaway posts $2.68 bn loss in Q3, operating profit rises 20%
300.article_body: Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway posted a net loss of $2.68 billion in the third quarter, against a $10.34 billion gain a year before. In the second quarter of this year, Berkshire reported a $43.8 billion loss. Berkshire Hathaway's operating profit rose 20% in the third quarter to $7.76 billion after taxes, beating analysts' estimates.

301.title: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' is not scripted: Neelam Kothari
301.article_body: Actress Neelam Kothari has said her web show, 'The Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', is not scripted. "They tell us we'll be shooting at such and such venue but what we discuss is up to us. We decide to fight and cry, it depends on us," she added. The show also features Bhavana Pandey, Seema Sajdeh and Maheep Kapoor.

302.title: SRK calls Akshay a 'wonderful friend', says Salman is 'awesome & very kind'
302.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan conducted an #AskSRK session on Twitter during which he spoke about his equation with Akshay Kumar and Salman Khan. When a fan asked him to describe Salman in one word, he said, "Awesome and very kind (sorry two words)...but bhai hai na." After a user wrote, "Say something about...Akshay," he replied, "He's been...wonderful friend for years now."

303.title: Which sportspersons have been recommended for Arjuna Award as no cricketer included?
303.article_body: A total of 25 names have been reportedly recommended for this year's Arjuna Award, including badminton player Lakshya Sen, boxer Nikhat Zareen and chess Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa. No cricketer has reportedly been recommended for the award. Other athletes include Avinash Sable, Vikas Thakur, HS Prannoy, Eldhose Paul, Anshu Malik and Sreeja Akula, among others.

304.title: Who is 16-year-old Ankith who'll represent India at UN climate change summit?
304.article_body: A 16-year-old boy from Hyderabad has been chosen to speak at the 2022 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27), which begins on Sunday in Egypt. Ankith Suhas Rao is the head boy of Hyderabad Public School and has been associated with his school's COP group. At COP27, he will present a paper on the kids' learnings on climate change.

305.title: Kohli ate everything, became quite fat and changed all of that with will power: Dhawan
305.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who is celebrating his 34th birthday today, Shikhar Dhawan said that Kohli's self belief is very strong. He added, "He is quite disciplined as well, he ate everything and became quite fat and he changed all of that with his will power." He further said that Kohli's mindset is "very positive".

306.title: Dalits treated like slaves for past 75 years: Ex-Bihar CM Manjhi
306.article_body: Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi said Dalits have been treated like "slaves" and untouchables by Hindus for the "past 75 years". "Priests are reluctant to perform ceremonies...and even when they do, they do not agree to accept food offered by you," said Manjhi. The BJP, in response, asked Manjhi to "come clean" on his "religious identity".

307.title: Climate activists block private jet take-offs at Amsterdam airport
307.article_body: More than 100 climate activists on Saturday stormed into an area where private jets are parked at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport and prevented several planes from departing by sitting in front of their wheels. The protest was part of demonstrations in and around the airport against greenhouse gas emissions and other pollution caused by the airport and aviation industry.

308.title: 100-yr-old building collapses after heavy rains in Chennai; 2 dead
308.article_body: A 100-year-old building on NSC Bose road in Chennai, which was identified as unsafe by the Greater Chennai Corporation in 2014, collapsed on Friday following heavy rains. Kangudevi (60) and Sankar (36) died in the incident. Two other people were hospitalised with minor injuries. Fire service and police officials were rushed to the spot to carry out a rescue operation.

309.title: State needs a BJP govt that would provide stability: PM Modi in Himachal
309.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday criticised the Congress and said that Himachal Pradesh needs a government that would provide stability. Addressing an election rally in Solan, PM Modi said, "During Congress' rule, there were various groups that had...vested interest in unstable governments." "You need not remember the BJP candidate, only remember the symbol of 'Lotus'," PM Modi added.

310.title: PM handing out few thousand jobs while millions unemployed: Kharge
310.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said PM Narendra Modi is handing over some thousand appointment letters when "millions of youth search for jobs". "Our youth is forced to wait for years...All this is because of lack of will and false promises," he said. Kharge added that it took the Centre 10 years to 'even think' of filling existing central government vacancies.

311.title: NIA files charges against Dawood, 4 aides in terror funding case
311.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday filed charges against gangster Dawood Ibrahim, his close aide Chhota Shakeel and three other associates for allegedly arranging funds for terror activities. The accused had allegedly raised, collected and extorted money by threatening individuals. The funds collected were meant for the benefit of "an individual terrorist", the NIA stated.

312.title: People will say 'jai Ram ji ki' to Jairam Thakur in Himachal: Baghel
312.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday said that people of Himachal Pradesh will say "jai Ram ji ki" (bid farewell) to Jairam Thakur-led BJP government in the state. "[BJP has] created a hole in people's pockets by increasing the prices of petrol...and cooking gas," the Congress leader added. He claimed the Congress is taking issues like inflation and unemployment seriously.

313.title: 75-yr-old man mauled to death by tiger in Maha: Forest official
313.article_body: A 75-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in the forest of Chandrapur district in Maharashtra, a forest official informed. Jagan Panse, a resident of Lakhapur village, had gone into the forest to collect firewood on Friday but did not return home, the official said. Panse's body was found in the forest on Saturday morning, the official added.

314.title: Rahane-led Mumbai defeat Himachal to win Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for 1st time ever
314.article_body: Ajinkya Rahane-led Mumbai defeated Himachal Pradesh by three wickets to win Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) for the first time ever. Batting first, Himachal Pradesh posted a total of 143/8, with Ekant Sen top-scoring with 37(29). Mumbai chased down the target in 19.3 overs, with Sarfaraz Khan scoring 36*(31). Both Himachal and Mumbai were featuring in their first SMAT final.

315.title: Cong means guarantee of corruption, selfish politics: PM in Himachal
315.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing an election rally in Himachal Pradesh's Solan on Saturday, said, "Congress means guarantee of corruption and selfish politics." "During Congress rule, there were various groups that had a vested interest in unstable governments. Small states were the target of such self-centred groups," he added. "These groups worked only for their own interests," the PM said.

316.title: It was an amazing fight, we could have done better: Dasun after loss to Eng
316.article_body: After losing to England on Saturday, Sri Lankan skipper Dasun Shanaka said that it was an "amazing fight". "We could have done better. I think the wicket played a part in this game...It was the powerplay where we didn't bowl well, they (England) played well," Shanaka said. He added, "Catching has been a problem...we need to go back and improve."

317.title: Pakistan secures $13 bn in financial aid from China & Saudi Arabia: Report
317.article_body: Pakistan has secured $9 billion from China and $4 billion from Saudi Arabia in financial aid on top of assurances for about $20 billion in investments, the Dawn newspaper reported. During Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's recent Beijing visit, China also agreed to fast-track the processing for a $9.8 billion high-speed rail project from Karachi to Peshawar, the report added.

318.title: 'Jana Gana Mana' & 'Vande Mataram' must be given the same level of respect: Govt
318.article_body: The national anthem of India ('Jana Gana Mana') and the national song ('Vande Mataram') have equal status, the Centre has told Delhi High Court. Every Indian citizen must show the same level of respect to both songs, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. 'Vande Mataram' has a "unique and special place in the emotions...of the people of India," it added.

319.title: PM Modi visits Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera, meets Baba Dhillon
319.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday visited Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera in Punjab and met its chief Baba Gurinder Singh Dhillon. The PM also went to the community kitchen where women followers were preparing food. Earlier, he hailed the community service efforts undertaken by the organisation. The dera has followers in several states, including Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan.

320.title: These situations are built for Stokes: Buttler after win over Sri Lanka
320.article_body: After winning against Sri Lanka, England skipper Jos Buttler said that these situations are made for all-rounder Ben Stokes who scored a match-winning 42*(36) on Saturday. "He (Stokes) can play a lot of roles for us in this T20 setup...[Sri Lanka] got off to a really good start...But the way Adil Rashid got us back was wonderful," Buttler said.

321.title: Dover immigration centre attack was a terrorist incident: UK police
321.article_body: British police on Saturday said evidence showed the petrol bomb attack on the Dover immigration facility last week was a terrorist incident motivated by an extreme right-wing ideology. "There's currently nothing to suggest the offender was working alongside anyone else," police added. There are strong indications that the suspect's mental health was also a factor in the attack, police said.

322.title: Will never happen: SRK to fan asking about Kardashian-like show on his family
322.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan, during an #AskSRK session on Twitter, replied to a fan who asked, "If you and your family had a TV show like the Kardashians, what would it be called?" The actor responded, "It will never happen we are a very private family...but Khandaan I guess??!" On the work front, Shah Rukh will be seen in 'Pathaan'.

323.title: Postpone rear seat belt rule till Dec 31: Mumbai Taxi Union to police
323.article_body: The Mumbai Taxi Union has written to the Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) requesting him to postpone the implementation of the rear passenger seat belt to December 31. The Union said many operators had removed the rear seat belt and there was a delay in availability. The Union also welcomed the decision to impose fines on passengers and not drivers.

324.title: Varun breaks down remembering late driver, says 'I'm still dealing with it'
324.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan broke down in tears while remembering his late driver Manoj Sahu at a recent event. Manoj, who had been with him for 26 years, passed away after suffering a heart attack earlier this year. Talking about his demise, Varun said, "It's taken me...long time to find...courage to talk about this. But, honestly, I'm still dealing with it."

325.title: Delhi's pupil-teacher ratio for upper primary worst in India: Report
325.article_body: Delhi has the poorest student-teacher ratio in the upper primary school level (classes VI to VIII) in the country for 2021-22, the Unified District Information System for Education Plus said. The ratio of teacher-pupil in the upper primary level in Delhi is 33:1. In the primary level (classes I to V), Delhi has the second poorest student-teacher ratio after Bihar.

326.title: TN man picking his daughter assaulted by youths outside college
326.article_body: A video showing some youths allegedly assaulting a 50-year-old man who had come to pick up his daughter from Sri Meenakshi Government Arts College for Women in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has surfaced online. Police said a funeral procession was passing near the college entrance when the students were exiting the college. Six people have been arrested so far, police added.

327.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
327.article_body: As per IMD, heavy rainfall is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Jammu & Kashmir on Sunday. It is very likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands from November 6 to 8. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Tamil Nadu on Sunday. It is very likely over Kerala and Puducherry from November 6 to 9.

328.title: Everything was so public, I felt haunted: Selena on breakup with Justin Bieber
328.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez opened up about her breakup with Justin Bieber and said, "Everything was so public. I felt haunted by a past relationship that no one wanted to let go of." "I feel like I'd to go through the worst possible heartbreak ever," she added. Selena and Justin broke up in 2018 after an on-off relationship of eight years.

329.title: Mumbai Congress leader booked for cheating jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh
329.article_body: A Congress leader has been booked by Mumbai Police for allegedly cheating a jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh. Mumbai Congress General Secretary Mohan Singh Saini allegedly took the money promising high returns but used it to fund his son's studies. Saini claims the money was to fund the studies but the complainant demanded exorbitant interest when he tried to return it.

330.title: Make field visits, step up surveillance: UP CM to officials amid dengue cases
330.article_body: Amid the rising dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh, CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday held a meeting with state health department officials and directed nodal officers to make field visits. He also instructed them to step up surveillance in the affected areas. "All municipal corporations and local bodies...should conduct special campaigns on cleanliness, fogging and anti-larva spray," he added.

331.title: Christian monastery pre-dating Islam discovered on UAE island
331.article_body: An ancient Christian monastery possibly dating back to the period preceding the emergence of Islam in the Arabian Peninsula has been discovered in the UAE, officials announced on Thursday. The monastery has been discovered on Siniyah Island of Umm Al Quwain emirate. Carbon dating indicates the samples found in the monastery's foundation date as far back as 534 AD.

332.title: 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore seized from Manipur man in Assam
332.article_body: Assam Police on Saturday arrested a Manipur-based man from the Sonapur area of Kamrup Metropolitan district for allegedly transporting over 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore, an official said. According to police, the tablets were seized from a four-wheeler vehicle coming from the Meghalaya side. "Commendable feat," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma wrote while sharing the information on Twitter.

333.title: Not great: Mark Wood on attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan
333.article_body: England's Mark Wood said that the attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan is "not great". "He's an ex-cricketer, so it's close to home for us," Wood said. He added, "We were looked after really well (during the tour to Pakistan in September-October 2022) but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't worried by that because you're going back there."

334.title: Password attacks rise to 921 every second globally: Microsoft
334.article_body: According to Microsoft's 'Digital Defense Report 2022', the volume of password attacks has risen to an estimated 921 attacks every second globally, a 74% increase in just one year. The report added Microsoft removed over 10,000 domains used by cybercriminals. From July 2021 to June 2022, Microsoft's digital defence teams blocked 34.7 billion identity threats and 37 billion email threats.

335.title: Producer alleges SRK's Jawan's story is copied from a Tamil film, files complaint
335.article_body: Producer Manickam Narayanan has alleged that Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film Jawan's story has been copied from Tamil film 'Perarasu'. Manickam has filed a complaint with the Tamil Film Producers Council (TFPC), accusing Jawan makers of plagiarism. TFPC board members will be investigating the complaint filed by Manickam after November 7, reports said.

336.title: I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran: Anupam Kher
336.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that he does not carry the burden of being a senior actor as doing so makes his life and job easy. "I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran, or uncle for that matter," Anupam said. "I don't allow that because these are the clichés decided by society," he added.

337.title: IT dept raids offices of former MLA Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto in UP, other states
337.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) department on Saturday conducted raids at the house, offices and factory of former BSP MLA and meat exporter Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto. The raids were carried out in Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Chandigarh (Punjab), Jaipur (Rajasthan), Aurangabad (Maharashtra), and Nuh (Haryana). They also searched the AOV Slaughter House of HMA Group in Unnao.

338.title: Tower D of Gurugram’s Chintels Paradiso Society to be demolished
338.article_body: Tower D of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso Society will be demolished as per the recommendations of a report by IIT, Delhi, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav on Saturday. A structural audit of the tower was conducted after a portion of an apartment collapsed in February this year, killing two women. The tower has over 50 flats.

339.title: 36th edition of Pune International Marathon to be held on December 4
339.article_body: The 36th edition of the Pune International Marathon will be held on December 4. The run will start at midnight and end at 9 am. "The night timing helps us to conduct a smooth race and we can avoid traffic chaos," said the President of Pune International Marathon Trust. The men's and women's full marathon will be 42.195 km long.

340.title: BJP MP Rita found guilty of model code violation during 2012 UP polls
340.article_body: A special court on Friday found BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi and four others guilty of violating the Model Code of Conduct during the 2012 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. Rita, who was a Congress leader in 2012, had allegedly addressed a rally after the campaigning period had ended. The court asked the convicts to file two sureties of ₹20,000 each.

341.title: US Treasury Secy Yellen to visit India on Nov 11 for economic meet
341.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will visit New Delhi on November 11 to participate in the 9th India-US Economic and Financial Partnership dialogue. "Secretary Yellen will highlight the strength of the US' partnership with India, which continues to deepen," US Treasury Department said. She will hold a bilateral meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss India's G20 presidency.

342.title: 6 people, including madrassa students, drown in lake in Telangana
342.article_body: Five madrassa students and their teacher drowned in a lake in Telangana's Medchal-Malkajgiri district. According to the officials of the Jawaharnagar Police Station, the students entered the lake to swim and could not come out after which their teacher also entered the lake. The deceased had come to the Malkaram area to attend a function, police said.

343.title: Family demands martyr status for slain Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri
343.article_body: The family of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, who was shot dead in Amritsar on Friday, has demanded martyr status for him. His son Manik Suri said, "We're demanding status of martyr for my father, suspension of negligent officers & security and another accommodation for us." "Won't cremate him until our demands are met," he added.

344.title: Hyderabad is water sufficient for next 40 years: Water board MD
344.article_body: The Managing Director of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), Dana Kishore, said that Hyderabad is water sufficient for the next 40 years. Addressing the Telangana Infra Summit 2022 on the theme 'Physical infrastructure and realty prospects and challenges', Kishore cited an Oxford Cities report and said that by 2030, Hyderabad may have a GDP of $85 billion.

345.title: I check for hidden cameras in my hotel rooms, I'm extremely cautious: Dia
345.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza opened up about the security measures she takes before checking into a hotel room. "A thorough check for hidden cams, getting the hotel to assign a room after arrival, keeping the room number private etc," she said. Dia further said she became "extremely cautious" after "videos of actresses bathing surfaced on the net about a decade ago".

346.title: Delhi LG 'misusing powers', he should fight MCD polls: AAP leader
346.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Saturday criticised Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and  accused him of "misusing his powers". "Since there's a change in Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) and there are 250 wards now...We want LG VK Saxena to fight the upcoming municipal elections in Delhi," Pathak said. "Let's see whether the citizens support him or not," he added.

347.title: Saw exorbitant amount of money reaching AAP Gujarat office: Ex-AAP leader
347.article_body: After rejoining Congress, former AAP leader Indranil Rajguru said that he saw an exorbitant amount of money reaching the latter's Gujarat state office. "[AAP's] CM face was pre-decided and I was told not to insist and that [MLA] list comes from Kamalam (Gujarat BJP headquarters)...It's a party that befools people. So, I returned to Congress," Rajguru said.

348.title: BMC to concretise, revamp road leading to Maha Dy CM Fadnavis' home
348.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken concretisation and beautification work of roads near Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' residence. The total cost of the tender is ₹22.27 crore and the roads which are going to be concretised are Narayan Dabholkar road and J Mehta road. An advanced drainage system and utility ducts will also be constructed, an official said.

349.title: Ind cricket was lacking fitness, fielding side of things before Kohli: Deep
349.article_body: Ex-cricketer Deep Dasgupta said that Indian cricket was lacking in the fitness and fielding side of things before Virat Kohli's impact. "Kohli's impact on Indian cricket is humongous," Dasgupta said.
