He added, "Kohli looks at himself as an athlete as cricket demands a different fitness skill set...I am so glad that he has got his mojo back."

350.title: NIA arrests 3 PFI workers in Praveen Nettaru murder case
350.article_body: The NIA on Saturday arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) workers from Bengaluru and Dakshina Kannada district in connection with the killing of BJP Yuva Morcha member Praveen Nettaru. The agency carried out raids at five locations in Dakshina Kannada, Hubballi and Mysuru. Digital devices and incriminating documents were allegedly seized from the houses of the accused.

351.title: BJP offered to drop charges against Jain, Sisodia if we left Guj polls: Kejriwal
351.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has claimed that the BJP offered to dissolve cases against AAP ministers if the party quit the Gujarat Assembly elections. "After Manish Sisodia rejected their offer to be Delhi Chief Minister by leaving AAP, they've approached me now," Kejriwal said. "They've said if you leave Gujarat...we'll spare...Satyendar Jain and Sisodia," he added.

352.title: Case filed against Dr Anahita who drove car that crashed, killing Cyrus Mistry
352.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was travelling during his accident in September, has been booked by police in Maharashtra. Pandole is still in the ICU and is undergoing treatment due to injuries from the accident. Police recorded her husband Darius Pandole's statement. Mistry was killed in the accident.

353.title: ‘Holy mud’ to be used for unveiling of Kempegowda statue in B'luru
353.article_body: A team of four ministers of the Karnataka government visited three historical places in the state to collect the holy mud to be used during the unveiling of the Kempegowda statue. The soil has been collected from Hampi, Kudalasangama and Kitturu. The 108 feet bronze statue at Bengaluru Airport will be unveiled by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 11.

354.title: 19-year-old college student run over by speeding crane dies in B'luru
354.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died at a hospital on Friday, two days after being run over by a mobile crane which was allegedly being driven at high speed in Bengaluru's Whitefield. A CCTV footage showed Noor Fatima, a first-year BCom student, walking on the road before the vehicle hit her. The driver of the crane, Periya Swamy, has been arrested.

355.title: Bank of Baroda posts 59% YoY rise in Q2 net profit to ₹3,313 crore
355.article_body: Bank of Baroda reported a 58.7% year-over-year increase in net profit for the July-September quarter to ₹3,313.42 crore from the previous fiscal's ₹2,087.85 crore. The public sector lender's net interest income surged 34.5% to ₹10,174.46 crore during the second quarter. The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped 22.06% to ₹46,374.4 crore from last September's ₹59,503.82 crore.

356.title: Actor Govinda bumps into his lookalike at Mumbai airport, video surfaces
356.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Govinda bumping into his lookalike, who was dressed in a maroon suit and wore sunglasses, at the Mumbai airport. In the video, the lookalike can be seen presenting a bouquet to Govinda and posing with him for the paparazzi. "Who is the real Govinda?" a fan joked. "Same to same," wrote another.

357.title: Virat Kohli cuts birthday cake with Indian journalists at MCG, video goes viral
357.article_body: Indian journalists covering the T20 World Cup 2022 surprised Virat Kohli with a cake at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on the occasion of his 34th birthday. "Very nice gesture. This is a historic venue and all the media people are here, so it's a very nice gesture," Kohli said. The journalists also presented Kohli with a greeting card.

358.title: Notices sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms
358.article_body: Notices have been sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms between November 1 and 4, officials said. "We will be taking strict action against illegal rooftop restaurants...Engineers...are personally visiting these restaurants and issuing notices," said a Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official. This came after a fire broke out in Lulla Nagar on November 1.

359.title: Musk bought outfit that spews lies across the world: US Prez on Twitter deal
359.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday reacted to the world's richest man Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition deal, saying the latter bought "an outfit that...spews lies all across the world". "There are no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" Biden added. Musk has called himself a "free speech absolutist".

360.title: When I turn producer, I will tell actors to slash their prices: Rajkummar
360.article_body: Rajkummar Rao, when asked if actors should reduce their prices if their films don't work well, said, "I can't tell others to slash rates...This is the call that...producers will have to take." He added he will ask actors to slash their prices "a bit" when he will become a producer. Rajkummar further said he doesn't charge much for his projects.

361.title: How does the final T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table read?
361.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia accumulated seven points each in Group 1 of T20 World Cup 2022's Super 12 stage. New Zealand and England advanced to the semi-finals with a net run-rate of +2.113 and +0.473, respectively. Afghanistan finished last on the table with three losses in five matches. Ireland won just one match, while Sri Lanka won two matches.

362.title: I got my first salary at the age of 13: Jaya Bachchan
362.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast, revealed that she got her first salary at the age of 13. "I don't even know how much I was paid," she added. Jaya further said when she went to study, she paid for her education as she did not want her father to finance her.

363.title: Sharad Pawar flies to Shirdi from Mumbai with doctors to attend NCP meet
363.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar flew to Shirdi today with a team of doctors to attend a party meet. He has been undergoing treatment at the Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai. "I am sure the situation will change...Party cadres wished that I come for the meeting where discussions on the ideology...and policies of the NCP are being discussed," said Pawar.

364.title: You forced me to bring 20-30 people to give ₹500cr cash to AAP: Sukesh to Kejriwal
364.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, while addressing Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal in a letter, accused the latter of receiving money in exchange for seats. "Kejriwal ji, why you forced me to bring 20-30 more individuals to contribute ₹500 crore cash to AAP in return for seats and postings in AAP Karnataka and Tamil Nadu in 2016?" He alleged.

365.title: Labourers fighting over water fall from Thane building's 2nd floor, 1 dead
365.article_body: Two labourers staying in a building in Thane's Bhiwandi got into a fight over who of the two would go to fetch water from the ground floor. Both of them fell from the second floor of the building, following which one of them died. The other one has been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

366.title: England reach T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after win vs SL; Australia knocked out
366.article_body: England advanced to semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022 after defeating Sri Lanka by four wickets in their last Super 12 stage Group 1 match. England finished second on the points table with seven points and a superior net run-rate than Australia, who have been knocked out of the tournament. New Zealand qualified for semi-finals from Group 1 on Friday.

367.title: Regional parties in T'gana, Andhra are 'match fixing' parties: Jairam Ramesh
367.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that only Congress can fight with the BJP as all the regional parties in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are "match fixing" parties. "[All the regional parties] have a good understanding with the BJP. All…are scared of ED, I-T and CBI," said Ramesh. He added that Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will act as a booster.

368.title: Himanshu Vyas joins BJP after resigning from Congress' primary membership
368.article_body: Former Congress leader Himanshu Vyas joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Saturday, hours after resigning as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. He joined the party at the Gujarat BJP office 'Shri Kamalam' and was welcomed by Union Home Minister Amit Shah and State Party President C R Paatil.

369.title: 57-yr-old BMC official caught while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe, booked
369.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) was allegedly caught by Anti-Corruption Bureau while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe to stop action against a company for illegal construction in Andheri, an official said. The accused was posted at the BMC's K-east ward. A case has been registered under relevant provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

370.title: Iranian footballer wears slogan against Iran's hijab rule in ISL match, sent off
370.article_body: Iranian footballer Vafa Hakhamaneshi was dismissed after getting his second yellow card during an Indian Super League (ISL) match in Bengal after he revealed his vest with slogans protesting Iran's mandatory hijab rule. Hakhamaneshi went toward the cameras after scoring his first goal in India and lifted his t-shirt to reveal the slogan "#women #life #freedom for 11:11".

371.title: Russia struggling to train newly mobilised troops: UK
371.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russia is probably struggling to provide military training for its current mobilisation drive and annual autumn conscription intake. According to the ministry, newly mobilised conscripts likely have "minimal training or no training at all". "Experienced officers and trainers have been deployed to fight in Ukraine and some have likely been killed in...conflict," it added.

372.title: AIIMS Delhi to provide real-time info on beds from Dec 25
372.article_body: AIIMS Delhi will provide real-time status of beds in its general and private wards from December 25 through a 'Patient Care Dashboard' on its website, a memorandum by AIIMS Director Dr M Srinivas said. The website will also provide statistics regarding radiology tests. AIIMS Delhi has already launched a dashboard to show the availability of beds in its emergency department.

373.title: K-pop band NCT 127 ends concert after 30 fans faint in Indonesia
373.article_body: K-pop band NCT 127 was forced to end their first concert in Indonesia's Jakarta abruptly after 30 people fainted in a crush, police said. During the concert, the fans had started surging forward to get closer to the stage and because of this people fainted, the police added. NCT 127 member Taeyong has apologised for creating "bad memories".

374.title: Russia, China bent over backwards to justify North Korea's missile launches: US
374.article_body: US has accused Russia and China of "bending over backwards" to justify North Korea's ballistic missile launches. During a Security Council meeting on Friday, US also said that Russia and China provided "blanket protection" to Pyongyang from UN's actions. Representatives from Russia and China accused the US of escalating tensions by conducting joint military exercises with South Korea.

375.title: Punjab & Sind Bank's Q2 profit rises by 27% to ₹278 crore
375.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank reported a 27% rise in its net profit to ₹278 crore in the July-September quarter as against ₹218 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a reduction in bad loans. The lender's total income during the quarter surged to ₹2,120.17 crore. On Friday, the bank's stock closed 8.77% higher at ₹18.60 apiece on BSE.

376.title: BJP sticker seen on car used during IT raid on J'khand MLA, CM reacts
376.article_body: A video has surfaced purportedly showing a BJP sticker on a car in which Income Tax officials arrived to conduct raid at Jharkhand Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal Singh's residence on Friday. The sticker was later removed by a man wearing a BJP stole. Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Where lies morality?...[BJP is] robbing the mandate of people using central agencies."

377.title: Iran acknowledges sending drones to Russia for the first time
377.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian has acknowledged that Iran supplied drones to Russia, insisting that the transfer happened before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began. "We gave a limited number of drones to Russia months before the Ukraine war," Amirabdollahian said. Earlier this week, Iran's Ambassador to the UN said the allegations of sending drones were "totally unfounded".

378.title: T'gana CM KCR capable of acting in political field: BJP's NV Subhash
378.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR released a video to back poaching charges against the BJP, the Opposition party has called KCR an actor in the political field. BJP spokesperson NV Subhash called the allegations baseless and unwarranted. "KCR is capable of acting in [the] political field with his lies and dialogues and [can mesmerise] political workers with his lies," said Subhash.

379.title: Mumbai civic body starts resurfacing work on city's 18 roads
379.article_body: After taking verbal permission from the traffic police, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has taken up the work to resurface 18 of the 449 bad roads in Mumbai. "These are small internal roads which need resurfacing as they developed potholes during monsoon," a BMC official said. Out of these 18 roads, 14 are located in the city's western suburbs.

380.title: Man kills his parents & 2 sons, dumps bodies then kills self in Raj
380.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his parents and two sons, aged eight and 14, police said. The accused apparently dumped the bodies in a water tank before jumping into another tank, an SHO said. The police suspect the man drugged his wife and other family members, who were also present in the house, the SHO added.

381.title: Pharma company adopts African lion at Hyd's Nehru Zoological Park
381.article_body: Manohar, an African Lion, at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park has been adopted by Aurigene Pharmaceutical Services Limited for a period of one year. According to the zoo officials, representatives from the pharmaceutical company handed over a cheque of ₹1 lakh towards the adoption and maintenance charges of the lion. Last year, the company adopted a Royal Bengal tiger.

382.title: Tata Motors to hike prices of passenger vehicles by 0.9% from Nov 7
382.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday announced a marginal price hike across its passenger vehicles from November 7. "Effective November 7, 2022, the weighted average increase will be 0.9%, depending on the variant and model," the company said in a statement. "The steep rise in overall input costs has compelled...to pass on some proportion through this minimal price hike," the automaker added.

383.title: UP CM directs Noida, Greater Noida authorities to hire more staff
383.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed senior officials of the Noida and Greater Noida authorities to recruit more staff for smooth functioning. Notably, the Noida and Greater Noida authorities are functioning with only 25% staff, officials said. "We requested the CM if he could allocate personnel from the state government...We are also hiring contractual staff," an official said.

384.title: North Korea fires 4 ballistic missiles as US & South Korea end drills
384.article_body: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea, South Korean military said. Saturday launches come as US and South Korea wrapped up the "Vigilant Storm" exercise they began on Monday. North Korea has launched a series of missiles this week, raising concerns that it could be preparing to resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.

385.title: PM Modi condoles the death of independent India's first voter
385.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences over the death of 106-year-old Shyam Saran Negi who was independent India's first voter. "I bow my head in tribute to him with an emotional heart," he said. Adding that Negi had voted "over 30 times" in his life, the PM further said that this will inspire every citizen, especially the country's youth.

386.title: No communication from DoT since April: Vi on delay in equity conversion
386.article_body: When asked about the delay in the conversion of dues amounting to ₹16,130 crore into equity by the government, Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra said they are yet to hear from the Centre. "We have had no communication from the DoT since April when there was an agreement...don't know exactly the reason why this is not happening," Moondra said.

387.title: If I'm a 'thug' why did you get ₹50cr to offer RS seat to me?: Sukesh to Kejriwal
387.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar addressed Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, in a letter on Saturday. "Kejriwal ji, if I'm the country's biggest 'thug' according to you, then on what basis you received ₹50 crore from me and offered Rajya Sabha (RS) seat to me?" asked Chandrashekhar. "What does that make you? 'Maha thug'?" he added.

388.title: Fire breaks out in 15-storey building in Thane; residents evacuated
388.article_body: A fire broke out in a 15-storey building in Thane's Thakurli after an electric meter box in the building reportedly caught fire on Saturday morning. The fire spread across the duct comprising electric wires and reached the top floor, covering the building in thick smoke, fire officials said. Fire, however, didn't enter flats and all the residents were evacuated safely.

389.title: 'Jana Gana Mana, Vande Mataram' have equal status: Centre to Delhi HC
389.article_body: The Centre informed the Delhi HC that "Jana Gana Mana" and "Vande Mataram" both stand on the same level and that every citizen should show equal respect to both. The Center's response was to a PIL that asked the government to frame guidelines for the National Song, giving it the same honour and status as the National Anthem.

390.title: Girl collapses, dies after teacher punishes students at B'luru school
390.article_body: A primary schoolgirl collapsed in her classroom on Friday while a teacher was allegedly punishing all the students of her class at a private school in Bengaluru. She was rushed to a hospital by teachers but was declared brought dead, police said. Later, the school authorities took the girl's body to her home. The child's father has lodged a complaint.

391.title: List party workers to be chosen in civic body: Thiruvananthapuram Mayor to CPI(M)
391.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation Mayor Arya Rajendran allegedly wrote a letter to district secretary Anavoor Nagappan, seeking the priority list of party cadres to be appointed in temporary posts in the civic body. According to reports, Nagappan has said that he had not seen such a letter and that he cannot confirm if the letter was fake.

392.title: SBI posts highest-ever quarterly net profit after 74% YoY rise in Q2
392.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) on Saturday reported its highest-ever quarterly net profit of ₹13,264.62 crore, up nearly 74% year-over-year, for the July-September quarter. The country's largest state-run lender posted a 15% year-over-year increase in interest earned to ₹79,859.59 crore, while interest expended was ₹44,676.15 crore. At the end of Q2, SBI deposits stood at ₹41,90,254.88 crore.

393.title: They arrested my PA after not finding anything in ED raid: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
393.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday alleged that the Enforcement Directorate raided his personal assistant's residence in connection with the excise policy case and arrested him. "They got my house raided by filing false FIR...but found nothing against me," Sisodia tweeted. "They didn't find anything in ED's raid at my PA's house, so now they've arrested him," he added.

394.title: Kantara is doing really well, Hindi films are getting their a** kicked: Varun
394.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said people should take inspiration from films like 'Kantara', 'KGF Chapter 2' and 'Vikram', which are "doing really well". He added that Hindi films are "getting their a**** kicked right now". "It is a good time to be collaborative because cinema, in general, we are going through a big transition all over," Varun further said.

395.title: Jay Narayan Vyas quits BJP ahead of Gujarat polls, says he was fed up
395.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, former Health Minister Jay Narayan Vyas resigned from the BJP and said that he has kept his options open to join the Congress or the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "I was fed up with the BJP…I will contest the upcoming Gujarat elections from the Sidhpur constituency," said Vyas.

396.title: BJP MP Mahesh Sharma's close aide attacked in GB Nagar, hospitalised
396.article_body: A BJP worker and a close aide of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar MP Mahesh Sharma was attacked by unidentified miscreants in Greater Noida, following which he was hospitalised, police said. The victim was with two other BJP workers, police added. Their car was intercepted by around eight unidentified men who were in SUVs and carried arms with them, police stated.

397.title: Russian President Putin calls for 'evacuation' from Kherson region
397.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that civilians in Ukraine's Kherson region should be "evacuated" from the conflict zone. "Those who live in Kherson should be removed from the zone of the most dangerous actions, because the civilian population should not suffer," Putin told pro-Kremlin activists. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces annexed by Russia in September.

398.title: Peon allegedly rapes teen friend at Delhi govt hospital; arrested
398.article_body: A peon at Delhi government's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital was arrested for allegedly raping a teenage girl, police said on Friday. In her statement, the victim said the accused was her friend whom she had called to meet while she was at the hospital. The accused then allegedly took her to a room in the hospital and raped her.

399.title: MP RTI activist reaches municipality on bullock-cart to collect 9,000-page information
399.article_body: Right to Information activist Makhan Dhakad reached the municipality office in Madhya Pradesh's Bairad town on a bullock cart with a band to collect 9,000-page information in response to his plea. It was a matter of celebration for Dhakad as his application was earlier rejected by the civic body. He had sought information about PMAY around two months back.

400.title: Unacademy's monthly burn down to $7 million from $20 million: CEO
400.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal has said that the company has brought down its monthly burn to $7 million from $20 million. This was in response to a Twitter user who said, "Oh, the irony. Isn't Unacademy burning millions?" "Winter will get worse. Get to profitability asap...Stop all unnecessary spends. Focus on building great Products," Munjal said in the tweet.
